en: The vision of Isaiah the son of Amoz, which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem, in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.
hmr: Amoz naupa Isaiin Judahai lal Uzzia, Jotham, Ahaz le Hezekia hai inlal laia Judahai le Jerusalem chungchâng thua inlârna a hmu chu.

en: Hear, O heavens, and give ear, O earth; for Jehovah hath spoken: I have nourished and brought up children, and they have rebelled against me.
hmr: Aw vânhai, ngai unla, aw lei- hnuoi, na sit rawh, LALPA chun thu a hril ie: “Nauhai chu ka châwm puitling a, ka chungah an hel ta sih a.

en: The ox knoweth his owner, and the ass his master’s crib; but Israel doth not know, my people doth not consider.
hmr: Bâwngchal chun a pu a hriet a, sabengtung khawma a pu bupêkna a hriet bawk a, Israelhai ruok chun an hriet si nawh a; ka mihai chun an ngaituo naw a nih,” tiin.

en: Ah sinful nation, a people laden with iniquity, a seed of evil-doers, children that deal corruptly! they have forsaken Jehovah, they have despised the Holy One of Israel, they are estranged and gone backward.
hmr: A! hnam suol, khawhlona riktak phur mihai, chithla thil ṭha naw thaw- tuhai, nau rilotaka khawsa hlakhai an nih. LALPA chu an mâksan a, Israelhai Mi Inthieng chu an hmusit a, insuktumin an hnungtawl tah.

en: Why will ye be still stricken, that ye revolt more and more? the whole head is sick, and the whole heart faint.
hmr: Iengdinga hel zuol deu deu a, vuoka la um rawp ding am in nih a? Lu chu a pumin a nah a, lungril khawm chu a pumin a châu tah.

en: From the sole of the foot even unto the head there is no soundness in it; but wounds, and bruises, and fresh stripes: they have not been closed, neither bound up, neither mollified with oil.
hmr: Kepha hnuoia inthawka lu chenin a dam lai hrim a um nawh; pawp dâm, vuok duk chur dâm, pânna hnâi la ruok an nih; chuong chu an hmetping nawh a, an tuom bawk nawh a, sahriek khawm an nâl bawk nawh.

en: Your country is desolate; your cities are burned with fire; your land, strangers devour it in your presence, and it is desolate, as overthrown by strangers.
hmr: In ram chu rausanin a um zo a, in khuohai chu meiin a kâng zo a, in ram chu ram dang mihaiin in mithmu ngeiah an nei zo a, ram dang mihai suksiet angin a se zo tah.

en: And the daughter of Zion is left as a booth in a vineyard, as a lodge in a garden of cucumbers, as a besieged city.
hmr: Zion naunu chu grêp huona vêngbûk ang le, fanghma huona ṭu ang le, khawpui inhuolvêl anga mâksanin a um tah.

en: Except Jehovah of hosts had left unto us a very small remnant, we should have been as Sodom, we should have been like unto Gomorrah.
hmr: Sipaihai LALPA chun hlabîkhai tlâwmte mi lo hlapêk naw sienla chu Sodom ang khan um dai tâng ei ta, Gomorra ang el khan um tâng ei tih.

en: Hear the word of Jehovah, ye rulers of Sodom; give ear unto the law of our God, ye people of Gomorrah.
hmr: Sodom rorêltuhai, LALPA thu hi hre unla, Gomorra mihai, ei Pathien dân thua hin na sit ro!

en: What unto me is the multitude of your sacrifices? saith Jehovah: I have had enough of the burnt-offerings of rams, and the fat of fed beasts; and I delight not in the blood of bullocks, or of lambs, or of he-goats.
hmr: LALPA chun, “In inthâwina zozai hi ka ta dingin ieng am a ṭhang- kaina a um a? Berâmchal pumraw- hmanga inhlân le, ran châwm thâu- hai thâu chu ka nghawk tah; bâwng- chalhai le berâmte le kêlchalhai thisena hin ka lâwm ta nawh.

en: When ye come to appear before me, who hath required this at your hand, to trample my courts?
hmr: Ka hmaa hin inlang dinga in hung hin, ka biekin inhuon sûng tuollai hi sir dingin tuin am a phût cheu a?

en: Bring no more vain oblations; incense is an abomination unto me; new moon and sabbath, the calling of assemblies,—I cannot away with iniquity and the solemn meeting.
hmr: Thilpêk mei meihai chu hung chawi ta ngai naw ro; thil riminhnik khawm chu ka ta dingin thil tirdak- umtak a nih; thla thar dâm, châwlni dâm inkhâwmpuia infiel khâwm dâm mei mei chu ka ngai thei naw tawp el; khawhlona mei mei a nih, inkhâwm ropuitak khawm hi.

en: Your new moons and your appointed feasts my soul hateth; they are a trouble unto me; I am weary of bearing them.
hmr: In thla tharhai le in hunbi nei ruoiṭhehai chu ka lungril chun a theida a nih; ka ta dinga thil hnawk- saktak a nih, tuor ka nghawk tah a nih.

en: And when ye spread forth your hands, I will hide mine eyes from you; yea, when ye make many prayers, I will not hear: your hands are full of blood.
hmr: Chuongchun, in kut in phar pha khawm in tienga chun ka hmai hip tâng ka ta, anih, vawi tamtak in ṭawngṭai hnung khawmin ngai ta naw ningah; in kuthai chu thisenin a sip sih a.

en: Wash you, make you clean; put away the evil of your doings from before mine eyes; cease to do evil;
hmr: Insâwp unla, insukfai ro, ka mithmu phâk nawah in thilthawhai hi a suolna chu sie hmang ro; suol thaw thaw el hi ma ta unla, thil ṭha thaw inchûk ta ro;

en: learn to do well; seek justice, relieve the oppressed, judge the fatherless, plead for the widow.
hmr: rorêlna fel zawng unla, nêk- sâwrna tuorhai chu ṭhangpui unla, pa bohai chu ro rêlpêk unla, hmeithaihai chu hrilpui ro,” ti hi.

en: Come now, and let us reason together, saith Jehovah: though your sins be as scarlet, they shall be as white as snow; though they be red like crimson, they shall be as wool.
hmr: LALPA chun, “Hung ta u, ngaituo tlâng ei tiu! In suolhai chu sen inlâr angin um ta sienla khawm, vûr angin vâr a tih; sen duk angin sen ta sienla khawm, berâm hmul angin um a tih.

en: If ye be willing and obedient, ye shall eat the good of the land:
hmr: Tiâwitak le thuâwitaka in um chun, in rama thil ṭhahai hi fâng in ta;

en: but if ye refuse and rebel, ye shall be devoured with the sword; for the mouth of Jehovah hath spoken it.
hmr: nisienlakhawm, in nuom nawh a, in hel chun kâwlhnâmin fa zo a ti cheu; LALPA bau chun chu chu a hril tah a nih,” a ta.

en: How is the faithful city become a harlot! she that was full of justice! righteousness lodged in her, but now murderers.
hmr: Iengtiziea khawpui ringumtak chu nawchizawra inchang el am a ni le aw! Rorêl felnaa sipnu a ni hlak vei leh! Amaa chun felna a um hlak a, tu ruok hin chu tuolthattuhai an um lem ta hi.

en: Thy silver is become dross, thy wine mixed with water.
hmr: I tangka chu a êksiein ân chang tah a, i uoin chu tui le pawl a ni tah a.

en: Thy princes are rebellious, and companions of thieves; every one loveth bribes, and followeth after rewards: they judge not the fatherless, neither doth the cause of the widow come unto them.
hmr: I mi lienhai chu mi hel hmang, inru hmanghai ruolhai an nih, mi tinin tham an nuom a, lâwmman an hnawt hlak; pa bohai ro an rêlpêk ngai nawh a, hmeithai thu hlak an kuom a tlung ngai nawh.

en: Therefore saith the Lord, Jehovah of hosts, the Mighty One of Israel, Ah, I will ease me of mine adversaries, and avenge me of mine enemies;
hmr: Chuleiin, LALPA, Sipaihai LALPA, Israelhai Mi Hrât chun, hieng ang hin a hril a nih: “A! A mi dotuhai hi sukfithla el ka ta, ka hmêl- mahai chungah phuba lâng ka tih:

en: and I will turn my hand upon thee, and thoroughly purge away thy dross, and will take away all thy tin;
hmr: chun, i chungah ka kut thlâk nâwk ka ta, i êksie chu faitakin sukbo ka ta, i suon po po chu la hmang vawng ka tih:

en: and I will restore thy judges as at the first, and thy counsellors as at the beginning: afterward thou shalt be called The city of righteousness, a faithful town.
hmr: chun, i chungah rorêltuhai chu a tîra an um ang khan inumtir nâwk ka ta, i sûnga remruottuhai chu a hmasa taka an um ang khan inumtir nâwk bawk ka tih; chu hnunga chun, ‘Felna khawpui, khawpui ringumtak,’ la tîng an ti che.

en: Zion shall be redeemed with justice, and her converts with righteousness.
hmr: Zion chu rorêlna fela sansuok ni tâng a ta, a sûnga mi nghakîr nâwkhai khawm felnaa sansuok nîng an tih.

en: But the destruction of transgressors and sinners shall be together, and they that forsake Jehovah shall be consumed.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, bawsetuhai le mi suolhai suksietna chu um inruol a ta, LALPA mâksantuhai khawm sukbohmangin um an tih.

en: For they shall be ashamed of the oaks which ye have desired, and ye shall be confounded for the gardens that ye have chosen.
hmr: In thingsaisuo dittakhai chu inzâpui tâng an ta, in huon thlanghai lei chun inzaktakin in um ta ding a nih.

en: For ye shall be as an oak whose leaf fadeth, and as a garden that hath no water.
hmr: Thingsaisuo a hna vuoi ta le, huon tui hmu naw ang el hi in ni ding a nih.

en: And the strong shall be as tow, and his work as a spark; and they shall both burn together, and none shall quench them.
hmr: Chun, mi hrâttak chu ziza pawn ang ni tâng a ta, a sinthaw chu meisi ang ni tâng a tih; chuongchun, kâng rêl an ta, tukhawma sukrêm naw ni hai,” tiin.

en: Woe unto them that decree unrighteous decrees, and to the writers that write perverseness;
hmr: Fel nawtaka thu ruottuhai le indik nawtaka ziektuhai chu an chung a rik ie!

en: to turn aside the needy from justice, and to rob the poor of my people of their right, that widows may be their spoil, and that they may make the fatherless their prey!
hmr: Pasiehai chu rorêlna fel inkhêltir ding le ka mihai laia pasiehai hmu thei ding âwm hrim hrim lâkpêk dinga, hmeithaihai chu an râllâk anga an um theina dingin le pa nei nawhai chu an thil lâkpêk anga an siem theina dinga thawtuhai chu.

en: And what will ye do in the day of visitation, and in the desolation which shall come from far? to whom will ye flee for help? and where will ye leave your glory?
hmr: Chuongchun, an hung kan nia cheu le hlataka inthawka râusanna hung tlung dinga inthawk ieng am thaw tâng in ta le? Ṭhangpuina hniin tu kuom âm tlân tâng in ta le? In ropuina chu khâw lai am mâksan tâng in ta le?

en: They shall only bow down under the prisoners, and shall fall under the slain. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
hmr: Salhai hnuoiahai chun kûn an ta, thata umhai hnuoiahai chun tlûng an tih, chu chau chu an chan ni tâng a tih. Chuong ang lâwma a thaw khawm chun a lunginsen chu a la bo chuong si nawh a, a kut chu a lân let ta rawp a.

en: Ho Assyrian, the rod of mine anger, the staff in whose hand is mine indignation!
hmr: Hung ta, Assuria mi, ka lungin- senna hembâwk, ka lungninawna chawitu hmawl!

en: I will send him against a profane nation, and against the people of my wrath will I give him a charge, to take the spoil, and to take the prey, and to tread them down like the mire of the streets.
hmr: Râllâk la ding le, thil lâkpêk la ding le kawtthlêr chirhak anga sir dingin ama chu Pathien inza naw hnam do dingin tir ka ta, ka lunginsenna mihai chu thaw dingin thu pêng ka tih.

en: Howbeit he meaneth not so, neither doth his heart think so; but it is in his heart to destroy, and to cut off nations not a few.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ama chun chu chuong ang chu a tum a ni nawh a, chuong ang chu a lungril khawma a ngaituo bawk nawh; hnam tam namêna tam lo suksiet le sukbo- hmang a nih a lungril lem chu.

en: For he saith, Are not my princes all of them kings?
hmr: “Ka mi lien po pohai hi lal vawng an ni naw am a nih? Kalno khuo chu Karkemis khuo ang el a ni tah a ni naw am a

en: Is not Calno as Carchemish? is not Hamath as Arpad? is not Samaria as Damascus?
hmr: Hamath khuo chu Arpad khuo ang el a ni tah a ni naw am a nih? Samari khuo chu Damaska khuo ang el a ni tah a ni naw am a nih?

en: As my hand hath found the kingdoms of the idols, whose graven images did excel them of Jerusalem and of Samaria;
hmr: Ka kut hin milimhai ram, Jerusalem khuo le Samari khuoa mi nêka milim siem fâwm ṭha lem neihai khawm, a zawng suok ta sih a,

en: shall I not, as I have done unto Samaria and her idols, so do to Jerusalem and her idols?
hmr: Samari khuo le a milimhai chunga ka thaw ang khan Jerusalem le a milimhai chunga khawm hin ka thaw ve naw ding am a nih?” a ti sih a.

en: Wherefore it shall come to pass, that, when the Lord hath performed his whole work upon mount Zion and on Jerusalem, I will punish the fruit of the stout heart of the king of Assyria, and the glory of his high looks.
hmr: Chu lei chun Lalpa chun, Zion tlâng le Jerusalem chunga sinthaw ding po po a thaw zo pha chun, Assuria lal a lungril chapo ra le a mit chapo ropuina chu la hrem ka tih.

en: For he hath said, By the strength of my hand I have done it, and by my wisdom; for I have understanding: and I have removed the bounds of the peoples, and have robbed their treasures, and like a valiant man I have brought down them that sit on thrones:
hmr: Ama chun, “Ka kut hrâtnain ka thaw tah a nih, ka varna le hin; ka bengvâr sih a: chi tin ramrihai hlak chu ka sawn a; an rohai hlak ka lâkpêk a, lalṭhungphaa ṭhunghai hlak chu mi huoitak thaw angin ka hnûk thlâk tah a;

en: and my hand hath found as a nest the riches of the peoples; and as one gathereth eggs that are forsaken, have I gathered all the earth: and there was none that moved the wing, or that opened the mouth, or chirped.
hmr: ka kut hin chi tin hausaknahai hlak chu vate bu angin a zawng suok a; miin vate tui a pui râusan hnung- hai an lâk angin, leihnuoi hluotuhai po po hi ka lâk vawng tah a nih; thla zâp amanih, bâu ka amanih, inhrâm hrim hrim khawm an um dêr si nawh a,” a ti a nih.

en: Shall the axe boast itself against him that heweth therewith? shall the saw magnify itself against him that wieldeth it? as if a rod should wield them that lift it up, or as if a staff should lift up him that is not wood.
hmr: Hreipui hin thil chêkna dinga a hmangtu chu a uongkhum ding am a nih? Thingâtna hin a âttu chu a hnuoisie ding am a nih? Hembâwkin ân lettuhai chu ân let vêl lem ang amanih, hmawlin thing ni si lo ân let lem ang el hi a nih!

en: Therefore will the Lord, Jehovah of hosts, send among his fat ones leanness; and under his glory there shall be kindled a burning like the burning of fire.
hmr: Chuleiin, LALPA, sipaihai LAL- PA chun, a mi thauhai laia chun chêrna tir a ta, a ropuina hnuoia chun meichawk lai zing ang hin mei sêmin um a tih.

en: And the light of Israel will be for a fire, and his Holy One for a flame; and it will burn and devour his thorns and his briers in one day.
hmr: Chun, Israelhai êntu chu mei dingin nîng a ta, an Mi Inthieng chu meichawk dingin ni bawk a tih: chu chun ni khat thilah a hlohlingneihai le a buorhai chu sukkângin sukbo- hmang a tih, hmawlin thing ni lo mihriem ân let lem ang elin maw!

en: And he will consume the glory of his forest, and of his fruitful field, both soul and body: and it shall be as when a standard-bearer fainteth.
hmr: A rampui le a hnuoi ṭha hmun ropuina khawm chu, thlarau le taksa chenin sukbohmang a tih, chuong- chun, inchikna chawitu a châu hun lai ang nîng a tih.

en: And the remnant of the trees of his forest shall be few, so that a child may write them.
hmr: A rampuia thing la um sunhai chu naupang ziek khawp chaua tlâwm ni tâng a tih.

en: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the remnant of Israel, and they that are escaped of the house of Jacob, shall no more again lean upon him that smote them, but shall lean upon Jehovah, the Holy One of Israel, in truth.
hmr: Chun, chu ni chun, Israelhai hlabîkhai le Jakob sûnghai laia a la dam sunhai chun anni thattu chu ring nâwk ta naw ni hai a; LALPA Israelhai Mi Inthieng chu, titakzetin ring lem tâng an tih.

en: A remnant shall return, even the remnant of Jacob, unto the mighty God.
hmr: Hlabîkhai, Jakobhai laia a la dam sunhai chu, Pathien hrâttak kuoma chun la kîr nâwk an tih.

en: For though thy people, Israel, be as the sand of the sea, only a remnant of them shall return: a destruction is determined, overflowing with righteousness.
hmr: I mi Israelhai chu tuisuoriet phaiphin zâtin um hai sien khawm, a la um sunhai chau chu an kîr nâwk ding a ni sih a; felna luong liemna suksietna chu tlung dinga ruot tlat a nih.

en: For a full end, and that determined, will the Lord, Jehovah of hosts, make in the midst of all the earth.
hmr: Lalpa sipaihai LALPA chun, tâwpna, tâwpna tlung ngei dinga ruot tlat chu, hnuoi chung po po lailia chun a la siem ding a ni sih a.

en: Therefore thus saith the Lord, Jehovah of hosts, O my people that dwellest in Zion, be not afraid of the Assyrian, though he smite thee with the rod, and lift up his staff against thee, after the manner of Egypt.
hmr: Chuleiin, Lalpa Sipaihai LAL- PA chun hieng ang hin a tih, “Aw ka mi, Ziona umhai, Aigupta rama an thaw ang khan hembâwka vaw cheuin a hmawl chu in chungah inlet sien khawm Assuria mi chu ṭi naw ro.

en: For yet a very little while, and the indignation against thee shall be accomplished, and mine anger shall be directed to his destruction.
hmr: Sâwt nawtêa chun lungni- nawna chu hrîkthlâkin um tâng a ta, ka lunginsenna khawm anni sukbo- hmangnain hrîkthlâkin um tâng a tih.

en: And Jehovah of hosts will stir up against him a scourge, as in the slaughter of Midian at the rock of Oreb: and his rod will be over the sea, and he will lift it up after the manner of Egypt.
hmr: Oreb lungpuia Midian mihai an that lai ang khan, sipaihai LALPA chun ama thaw dingin vuokna chu chawktho a ta, a hmawl chu tuisuo- riet chungtieng um a ta; Aigupta rama ân let ang khan inlet a tih.

en: And it shall come to pass in that day, that his burden shall depart from off thy shoulder, and his yoke from off thy neck, and the yoke shall be destroyed by reason of fatness.
hmr: Chu nia chun a rikphur chu i liengkoa inthawka lâk hmangin um a ta, a rîngkawl chu i rînga inthawka lâk hmangin um bawk a tih; hriek nâl lei chun rîngkawl chu suksietin um tâng a tih,” tiin.

en: He is come to Aiath, he is passed through Migron; at Michmash he layeth up his baggage;
hmr: Aiath khuo a tlung tah, Migron khuo a fe thleng tah; Mikmas khuoa chun a thuomhnaw a sie tah:

en: they are gone over the pass; they have taken up their lodging at Geba; Ramah trembleth; Gibeah of Saul is fled.
hmr: kâwnah an liem tah, Geba khuoah an riek tah; Rama khuohai chu an inthin an inthin el tah. Saula Gibea khuohai chu an tlânse tah.

en: Cry aloud with thy voice, O daughter of Gallim! hearken, O Laishah! O thou poor Anathoth!
hmr: Aw Gallim khaw naunu, i râwlin inringtakin ko rawh; aw Laisa khuo! ngai ta! aw Anathoth, lungsiet i va um ngei de!

en: Madmenah is a fugitive; the inhabitants of Gebim flee for safety.
hmr: Madmena khuohai chu tlân hmangin an um tah; Gebim khuoa umhai chu tlân hmang tumin an inhâwrkhâwm luoi luoi a.

en: This very day shall he halt at Nob: he shaketh his hand at the mount of the daughter of Zion, the hill of Jerusalem.
hmr: Vawisûn ngei hin Nob khuoah a châm ding a nih; Zion naunu tlâng, Jerusalem muol pâwng chu a kut a thin khum ie.

en: Behold, the Lord, Jehovah of hosts, will lop the boughs with terror: and the high of stature shall be hewn down, and the lofty shall be brought low.
hmr: Ngai ta, Lalpa, Sipaihai LALPA chun, thil râpthlâktakin a kâuhai chu sât thlâng a ta, insângtak takhai chu phûrin um a tih, a dâwk bîkhai khawm chu râwt hnuoiin um a tih.

en: And he will cut down the thickets of the forest with iron, and Lebanon shall fall by a mighty one.
hmr: Thîrin ramhnuoi thing bittak- hai chu phûr a ta, Lebanon Sidar thinghai chu mi ropui phûrin tlu dur dur a tih.

en: And there shall come forth a shoot out of the stock of Jesse, and a branch out of his roots shall bear fruit.
hmr: Jessai a bula inthawkin a dâwn hung suok a ta, a zunga inthawka kak suokhai chu râng a tih;

en: And the Spirit of Jehovah shall rest upon him, the spirit of wisdom and understanding, the spirit of counsel and might, the spirit of knowledge and of the fear of Jehovah.
hmr: chun, LALPA thlarau-varna le hriet theina thlarau, remruotna le hrâtna thlarau, hrietna le LALPA ṭina thlarau chu-a chungah fûng a tih.

en: And his delight shall be in the fear of Jehovah; and he shall not judge after the sight of his eyes, neither decide after the hearing of his ears;
hmr: Chuongchun, a lâwmna chu LALPA a ṭinaah nîng a ta, a mita a hmu angin ro rêl naw nih a, a naa a hriet angin kâwk el bawk naw nih a;

en: but with righteousness shall he judge the poor, and decide with equity for the meek of the earth; and he shall smite the earth with the rod of his mouth; and with the breath of his lips shall he slay the wicked.
hmr: rimsihai chu feltakin ro rêlpêk lem a ta, hnuoia mi thuhnuoirawlhai ta ding chun thlierbîk nei loin kâwkpêk bawk a tih; a bau hembâwk chun hnuoi hi vuong a ta, a hmûra thuok chun mi rilohai chu that a tih.

en: And righteousness shall be the girdle of his waist, and faithfulness the girdle of his loins.
hmr: Felna hi a kâwnghrên nîng a ta, ringumna hi a kâwngkhi nîng a tih.

en: And the wolf shall dwell with the lamb, and the leopard shall lie down with the kid; and the calf and the young lion and the fatling together; and a little child shall lead them.
hmr: Chun, satene chu berâmte leh um hmunkhat tâng an ta, keite chu kelte leh bawk hmunkhat tâng an tih; bâwngte le sakeibaknei vânglai le ran châwmthâuhai chu um hmunkhat tâng an ta; naupangtêin ṭhuoi dup dup a tih.

en: And the cow and the bear shall feed; their young ones shall lie down together; and the lion shall eat straw like the ox.
hmr: Chun, sebâwng le savawm chu tlâng an ta, an têhai chu bawk hmunkhat diel diel tâng an tih; chun, sakeibaknei chun bâwngchal angin bupâwl fa tâng a tih.

en: And the sucking child shall play on the hole of the asp, and the weaned child shall put his hand on the adder’s den.
hmr: Chun, nau nêne ne lai chu rûlriel kuo khotlângah inhnel tâng a ta, nau nêne nêk bân ta chun rûlhmuk intawmkûk kuo khotlânga chun a kut innghat a tih.

en: They shall not hurt nor destroy in all my holy mountain; for the earth shall be full of the knowledge of Jehovah, as the waters cover the sea.
hmr: Ka tlâng inthienga hrim hrim chun insuknat um ta naw nih a, insuksiet um bawk ta naw ni; tuihai hin tuisuoriet ân khum zing angin, leihnuoi hi LALPA hrietnain a sip zo vawng ta ding a nih.

en: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the root of Jesse, that standeth for an ensign of the peoples, unto him shall the nations seek; and his resting-place shall be glorious.
hmr: Chun, chu nia chun, Jessai zung, mi tin inchikna dinga ngîr chu ama ngei chu hnam tinin râwn an ta, a châwlna hmun chu ropui a tih.

en: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the Lord will set his hand again the second time to recover the remnant of his people, that shall remain, from Assyria, and from Egypt, and from Pathros, and from Cush, and from Elam, and from Shinar, and from Hamath, and from the islands of the sea.
hmr: Chun, chu nia chun LALPA chun a mihai, a thi mahla la um sun, Assuria rama inthawk dâmin, Aigup- ta rama inthawk dâmin, Pathros rama inthawk dâmin, Kus rama inthawk dâmin, Elam rama inthawk dâmin, Sinar rama inthawk dâmin, Hamath khuoa inthawk dâmin, tuisuoriet thlierkâra inthawk dâma la nâwk dingin a vawi hninaa chun a kut la phar nâwk a tih.

en: And he will set up an ensign for the nations, and will assemble the outcasts of Israel, and gather together the dispersed of Judah from the four corners of the earth.
hmr: Chun, hnam tin ta dingin inchikna târ suok a ta, Israel hnawt suoka umhai chu ṭhuoi khâwm a ta, Juda indarhai kâwl kil lia inthawkin ṭhuoi khâwm a tih.

en: The envy also of Ephraim shall depart, and they that vex Judah shall be cut off: Ephraim shall not envy Judah, and Judah shall not vex Ephraim.
hmr: Chuongchun, Ephraim hai îtthîkna chu bo tâng a ta, Juda hai sukbuoituhai chu sukbohmangin um tâng an tih; Ephraim hai chun Juda hai chu îtthîk ta naw ni hai a, Juda hai khawma Ephraim hai chu sukbuoi ta naw ni hai.

en: And they shall fly down upon the shoulder of the Philistines on the west; together shall they despoil the children of the east: they shall put forth their hand upon Edom and Moab; and the children of Ammon shall obey them.
hmr: Chuongchun, annihai chu thlangtienga Philistin mihai liengkoa chun zuk vuongin zu fûng an ta; khawsak nauhai chu rawk hmunkhat an tih; Edom le Moab mihai chungah an kut thlâk an ta; Ammon thlahai chun an thu awi tâng an tih.

en: And Jehovah will utterly destroy the tongue of the Egyptian sea; and with his scorching wind will he wave his hand over the River, and will smite it into seven streams, and cause men to march over dryshod.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun Aigupta tuisuoriet kilkawi chu sukse vawng a ta; Vadungpui khawm chu a thli lum vut vut chun a kut thin khum a tih; vadungtê pasaria siem khawp rauin vuong a ta, mihai chu kepha khawm hu loin infekaitir a tih.

en: And there shall be a highway for the remnant of his people, that shall remain, from Assyria; like as there was for Israel in the day that he came up out of the land of Egypt.
hmr: Chuongchun, Aigupta rama inthawka an suok nia, Israelhai ta dinga lamlien a lo um ang khan a mihai thi mahla la um sunhai ta ding chun Assuria rama inthawkin lamlien hung um a tih.

en: And in that day thou shalt say, I will give thanks unto thee, O Jehovah; for though thou wast angry with me, thine anger is turned away and thou comfortest me.
hmr: Chu nia chun hieng ang hin la hril i tih, “Aw LALPA, lâwm- thu hril ka ti che; ka chungah lo lunginsen ta la khawm, i lunginsen chu a bo tah a, nangin i mi thlamuon ta a ni hi.

en: Behold, God is my salvation; I will trust, and will not be afraid: for Jehovah, even Jehovah, is my strength and song; and he is become my salvation.
hmr: Ngai ta, Pathien chu ka san- damna a na, ring ka ta, ṭiin um naw ning ah; LALPA Jehova chu ka hrâtna le ka hla a ni sih a; a mi sandamtu a lo ni ta bawk a,” tiin.

en: Therefore with joy shall ye draw water out of the wells of salvation.
hmr: Chuleiin, sandamna tuikhura inthawk chun hlimtakin tui la chawi in tih.

en: And in that day shall ye say, Give thanks unto Jehovah, call upon his name, declare his doings among the peoples, make mention that his name is exalted.
hmr: Chu nia chun hieng ang hin la hril in tih, “LALPA kuoma chun lâwmthu hril unla, a thilthawhai chu mi tin kuomah inhriettir unla, a hming chu chawimawiin a um ti hril ro.

en: Sing unto Jehovah; for he hath done excellent things: let this be known in all the earth.
hmr: LALPA chawimawiin hla sak unla, ama chun thil ṭhatakhai chu a lo thaw ta sih a; chu chu hnuoi chunga um po pohaia hin hrietin um raw se.

en: Cry aloud and shout, thou inhabitant of Zion; for great in the midst of thee is the Holy One of Israel.
hmr: Ziona umhai, inringtakin khêk unla, khêk tuor tuor ro, Israelhai Mi Inthieng nangni laia um chu a ropui sih a,” tiin.

en: The burden of Babylon, which Isaiah the son of Amoz did see.
hmr: Babulon phurrik Amoz naupa Isaiin a hmu chu.

en: Set ye up an ensign upon the bare mountain, lift up the voice unto them, wave the hand, that they may go into the gates of the nobles.
hmr: Mi lienhai kawtkhârahai chun an lût theina dingin tlâng kawl ruoua chun inchikna târ suok unla, inring- takin anni chu ko unla, kutin hui ro.

en: I have commanded my consecrated ones, yea, I have called my mighty men for mine anger, even my proudly exulting ones.
hmr: Keima ngeiin ka mi ruothai chu thu ka pêk tah a, anih, ka mi hrâttak, ka mi indutaka hlimhai chu ka lung- insen hrîkthlatu dingin ka ko tah.

en: The noise of a multitude in the mountains, as of a great people! the noise of a tumult of the kingdoms of the nations gathered together! Jehovah of hosts is mustering the host for the battle.
hmr: Chu! tlânga mipui ri, mipui nasatak ri ang el chu! Chu! hnam tin rama mi um khâwmhai sa mur mur ri chu! Sipaihai LALPA chun râl thaw dingin sipaihai ân pun tâwl a ni chu.

en: They come from a far country, from the uttermost part of heaven, even Jehovah, and the weapons of his indignation, to destroy the whole land.
hmr: Annirawi, LALPA le a lung- ninawna hriemhreihai chu, ram hla- taka inthawk, kâwlkawdawng tâwp rêta inthawkin, ram po po hi sukse dingin an hung a ni chu.

en: Wail ye; for the day of Jehovah is at hand; as destruction from the Almighty shall it come.
hmr: Inrûm rak rak ro, LALPA ni chu a hnai ta sih a, Iengkimthawtheia in- thawka suksietna a hung tlung angin a hung tlung ding a nih.

en: Therefore shall all hands be feeble, and every heart of man shall melt:
hmr: Chuleiin, kut po po chu hrât naw nih a, mihriem lungril tinrêng khawm intuihmang a tih;

en: and they shall be dismayed; pangs and sorrows shall take hold of them; they shall be in pain as a woman in travail: they shall look in amazement one at another; their faces shall be faces of flame.
hmr: chun, ṭîng an ta, natna le lungninawnahai chun man tâwl a tih; nuhmei nauhase angin nâng an ta, mak inti tuong an ta; an hmêlhai chu meichawk hmêl ang ni tâwl a tih.

en: Behold, the day of Jehovah cometh, cruel, with wrath and fierce anger; to make the land a desolation, and to destroy the sinners thereof out of it.
hmr: Ngai ta, ram sukbohmang ding le chutaka mi suolhai chu a sûnga inthawka sukbohmang dingin LALPA ni chu nasatakin lunginsenna le lung- inthakna nasatak leh a hung tlung ding a nih.

en: For the stars of heaven and the constellations thereof shall not give their light; the sun shall be darkened in its going forth, and the moon shall not cause its light to shine.
hmr: Vân arasihai le a sizuchohai chun an var insuo naw ni hai a, nisa chu a suok laia sukthimin um a ta, thla khawma a var chu ân vartir ta naw ding a nih.

en: And I will punish the world for their evil, and the wicked for their iniquity: and I will cause the arrogancy of the proud to cease, and will lay low the haughtiness of the terrible.
hmr: Chun, khawvêl hi an suolna leiin hrem ka ta, mi rilohai chu an khawhlona leiin hrem bawk ka tih, chun, mi chapo ṭawnga mingem chu sukbo ka ta, mi ṭium chapona chu sukhnuoi bawk ka tih.

en: I will make a man more rare than fine gold, even a man than the pure gold of Ophir.
hmr: Mi hi rângkachak inthieng nêk khawma vâng lemin siem ka ta, mihriem ngei hi Ophir rângkachak inthieng nêk khawma vâng lemin siem ka tih.

en: Therefore I will make the heavens to tremble, and the earth shall be shaken out of its place, in the wrath of Jehovah of hosts, and in the day of his fierce anger.
hmr: Chuongchun, vân khi sukthin ka ta, sipaihai LALPA lunginsen leiin; a lunginsenna nasatak nia chun, hnuoi khawm hi a umna hmun sawn dawr khawpa sukhnîngin um a tih.

en: And it shall come to pass, that as the chased roe, and as sheep that no man gathereth, they shall turn every man to his own people, and shall flee every man to his own land.
hmr: Chun, sakhi hnawt zêk ang le, berâm tukhawm ikhal khâwm lo angin mi tinin mâni chipuihai tieng seng nghâng an ta, mi tin mâni ram tieng seng tlân hmang an tih.

en: Every one that is found shall be thrust through; and every one that is taken shall fall by the sword.
hmr: Tukhawm an hmu taphawt sun- thlengin um an ta, tukhawm an man taphawt kâwlhnâma sukthlûkin um an tih.

en: Their infants also shall be dashed in pieces before their eyes; their houses shall be rifled, and their wives ravished.
hmr: An nautêhai khawm an mit- hmuah innâwi dar khawpa hnuoi vuoknaa hmangin um an ta, an inhai chu rawkin um a ta; an nuhmeihai chu pâwngsuol tuokin um bawk an tih.

en: Behold, I will stir up the Medes against them, who shall not regard silver, and as for gold, they shall not delight in it.
hmr: Ngai ta, Media mihai anni thaw dingin chawktho ka ta, chuonghai chun tangka ngaisak naw ni hai a, rângkachak khawm lâwm naw ni hai.

en: And their bows shall dash the young men in pieces; and they shall have no pity on the fruit of the womb; their eye shall not spare children.
hmr: An thalngulhai chun tlangvâlhai chu suknâwi a ta; mi rîla ra lunginsietna hrim hrim nei naw ni hai a; an mit chun naupanghai khawm hla naw nih.

en: And Babylon, the glory of kingdoms, the beauty of the Chaldeans’ pride, shall be as when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah.
hmr: Chun, Babulon ramhai ropuina, Kaldai mihai isuong thil mawitak chu, Pathienin Sodom le Gomorra a sukbohmang lai ang khan la um a tih.

en: It shall never be inhabited, neither shall it be dwelt in from generation to generation: neither shall the Arabian pitch tent there; neither shall shepherds make their flocks to lie down there.
hmr: Iengtika khawm chutaka chun mi um ta naw ni hai a, suon um sûng po po chun a sûnga um um naw ni hai; Arab mihai chun chutaka chun an puon in chu zâr naw ni hai a; berâm vêngtuhaiin chutaka chun an berâm ruol chu inbawktir bawk naw ni hai.

en: But wild beasts of the desert shall lie there; and their houses shall be full of doleful creatures; and ostriches shall dwell there, and wild goats shall dance there.
hmr: Thlalêra ramsahai chutaka chun bawk an ta; an inhai chu thil- hring nguitakhaiin sip a tih; varîng- seihai chutaka chun chêng an ta, sakêlhai chutaka chun inhnel lem tâng an tih.

en: And wolves shall cry in their castles, and jackals in the pleasant palaces: and her time is near to come, and her days shall not be prolonged.
hmr: Satenehai chu an kulbîngahai chun inhrâm an ta, sihalhai khawm an lal in inhawitakahai chun inhrâm bawk an tih; chun, a hrem hun ding chu a tlung ding a ni tah a, a nihai khawm sukseiin um naw nih.

en: For Jehovah will have compassion on Jacob, and will yet choose Israel, and set them in their own land: and the sojourner shall join himself with them, and they shall cleave to the house of Jacob.
hmr: LALPA chun Jakob rawi chu lunginsiet a ta, Israelhai chu thlangin anni rama ngei chun a lân umtir ding a ni sih a; chun, ram dang mihai chun anni chu hung zâwm an ta, Jakob sûnghai chu chel tlat an tih.

en: And the peoples shall take them, and bring them to their place; and the house of Israel shall possess them in the land of Jehovah for servants and for handmaids: and they shall take them captive whose captives they were; and they shall rule over their oppressors.
hmr: Chun, chi tin chun anni ṭhuoi an ta, an hmun ding chu intlun an tih; chuongchun, Israel sûnghai chun LALPA rama chun anni chu suokpa- ahai le suoknuahai la nei an tih; anni sala mantuhai chu salah la man an ta, anni suknawmnatuhai chunga chun ro la rêl an tih.

en: And it shall come to pass in the day that Jehovah shall give thee rest from thy sorrow, and from thy trouble, and from the hard service wherein thou wast made to serve,
hmr: Chun, i lungngainaa inthawk dâm, i buoinaa inthawk dâm, sinthaw intaktak an inthawtirna chea inthawk dâma LALPAIN ân châwltir nia che chun hieng ang hi nîng a tih,

en: that thou shalt take up this parable against the king of Babylon, and say, How hath the oppressor ceased! the golden city ceased!
hmr: hi tîelna thu hi Babulon lal khêkkhumin la hril i tih, “Iengtizie am a na, nêksâwrtu chu a va re ta de! Iengtizie am a na, rângkachak khawpui chu a va re ta de!

en: Jehovah hath broken the staff of the wicked, the sceptre of the rulers;
hmr: LALPA chun mi rilo hmawl chu a suktliek tah; rorêltuhai lal hmawl chu;

en: that smote the peoples in wrath with a continual stroke, that ruled the nations in anger, with a persecution that none restrained.
hmr: mi tin lunginsen puma vaw zawt zawt hlak a, hnam tin lunginsen puma tu ikhap khawm ngai loa suk- nawmnatnaa ro rêlpêkna hlak chu.

en: The whole earth is at rest, and is quiet: they break forth into singing.
hmr: Leihnuoi pumpui hi a châwl a, a re vawng vawng a; hla an sak suok phut a.

en: Yea, the fir-trees rejoice at thee, and the cedars of Lebanon, saying, Since thou art laid low, no hewer is come up against us.
hmr: Anih, i chungthu leiin fârhai chu an hlim a, Lebanon tlânga sidar thinghai leh; ‘Suktlâwma i um chin chu phûr thlutu ding hrim hrim kan kuomah an hung ta ngai nawh.’ tiin.

en: Sheol from beneath is moved for thee to meet thee at thy coming; it stirreth up the dead for thee, even all the chief ones of the earth; it hath raised up from their thrones all the kings of the nations.
hmr: Hnuoi tienga inthawka Seol chu i hung tlung tuok ding chein, nangma leiin a buoi mur mur a nih; mithi, hnuoia ṭhuoituhai po po chu, nangma leiin a chawktho a, hnam tin lal po pohai chu an lalṭhungphaa inthawk chun a keitho tah.

en: All they shall answer and say unto thee, Art thou also become weak as we? art thou become like unto us?
hmr: Chuong po po chun nang chu bein, i kuomah hieng ang hin hril an tih, ‘Nang khawm keini ang bawkin i hrât naw ve tâm a nih? Keini um angin i um tâm a nih?

en: Thy pomp is brought down to Sheol, and the noise of thy viols: the worm is spread under thee, and worms cover thee.
hmr: I ropui bûr bûrna chu Seola ṭhuoi thlâk a ni tah, i perkhuong inri bur burhai leh; chawkchawnâl chu i hnuoiah ân phah a, thil ngêhai chun ân khum ta che a ni hi,’ tiin.

en: How art thou fallen from heaven, O day-star, son of the morning! how art thou cut down to the ground, that didst lay low the nations!
hmr: “Aw sikhawvar, zîngkâr naupa, iengtiziea vâna inthawka tla am i ni ta leh? hnam tin sukthlutu, iengtiziea hnuoia sât thlâka um am i ni ta leh?

en: And thou saidst in thy heart, I will ascend into heaven, I will exalt my throne above the stars of God; and I will sit upon the mount of congregation, in the uttermost parts of the north;
hmr: I lungrila chun, ‘Vânah hang fêng ka ta, Pathien arasihai chung tienga khin ka lalṭhungpha dawm sâng ka tih; chun, inkhâwmna tlâng, hmâr tâwp rêta uma chun ṭhung ka ta;

en: I will ascend above the heights of the clouds; I will make myself like the Most High.
hmr: sûm nêka insâng lemahai khin hang fêng ka ta, Achunghnungtak angin um ka tih,’ i ti hlak vei le khan.

en: Yet thou shalt be brought down to Sheol, to the uttermost parts of the pit.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Seolah, vânsam tâwp rêta dâm chun ṭhuoi thlâkin i um ding a ni si.

en: They that see thee shall gaze at thee, they shall consider thee, saying, Is this the man that made the earth to tremble, that did shake kingdoms;
hmr: A hmu taphawt che chun en ngun an ti cheh a, ‘Ama hi maw hnuoi sukthin a, ram tin sukhnîng a,

en: that made the world as a wilderness, and overthrew the cities thereof; that let not loose his prisoners to their home?
hmr: khawvêl thlalêr anga siem a, a khaw umhai sukbohmang a, a salhai an in tienga fe dinga insuo ngailo chu,’ tiin, i chanchin la sût an tih.

en: All the kings of the nations, all of them, sleep in glory, every one in his own house.
hmr: Hnam tin lal po po, an rêngin, mâni in sengah ropuitakin an in a.

en: But thou art cast forth away from thy sepulchre like an abominable branch, clothed with the slain, that are thrust through with the sword, that go down to the stones of the pit; as a dead body trodden under foot.
hmr: Nang ruok chu a zung kaksuok tirdakumtak le, râl ithat, kâwlhnâma sunthleng, khursûnga lunghai laia zu fehai silfên angin i thlân ina inthawka hlatakah pei suokin i um ta lem hi; ruong ke hnuoia sirde ang elin.

en: Thou shalt not be joined with them in burial, because thou hast destroyed thy land, thou hast slain thy people; the seed of evil-doers shall not be named for ever.
hmr: I ram i suksiet a, i khuoletuihai i that leiin anni laia phûmin um ve naw ti nih. Thil ṭha naw thawtuhai hming chu kumkhuoin sâm naw ni hai.

en: Prepare ye slaughter for his children for the iniquity of their fathers, that they rise not up, and possess the earth, and fill the face of the world with cities.
hmr: A tho a, leihnuoi hi khuoa an suksip nawna dingin, an puhai suol- na leiin a nauhai that zai rêl ro,” tiin.

en: And I will rise up against them, saith Jehovah of hosts, and cut off from Babylon name and remnant, and son and son’s son, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, anni chu thaw dingin tho ka tih, sipaihai LALPA chun a tih; Babulona inthawka hming le a la um sunhai le, naupa le a naupa naupa chu sukbohmang ka tih, LALPAIN a tih.

en: I will also make it a possession for the porcupine, and pools of water: and I will sweep it with the besom of destruction, saith Jehovah of hosts.
hmr: Saku ta dingin roah siem ka ta, tuihai ta dinga intling khâwmnaah siem bawk ka tih; sukbohmangna hmunphiin phît bawk ka tih, sipaihai LALPAIN a tih.

en: Jehovah of hosts hath sworn, saying, Surely, as I have thought, so shall it come to pass; and as I have purposed, so shall it stand:
hmr: Sipaihai LALPA chun hieng anga hrilin ṭawng ân khâm tah, “Matheiloin ka ngaituo ang tak hin hung tlung a ta;

en: that I will break the Assyrian in my land, and upon my mountains tread him under foot: then shall his yoke depart from off them, and his burden depart from off their shoulder.
hmr: ka ruot ang tak hin um bawk a tih: ka rama chun Assuria mi chu suksieng ka ta, ka tlângahai chun chîl hrep ka tih, ti ang hin; chu hnunga chun a rîngkawl inbâttir chu annia inthawk chun bo tâng a ta, an rik inphurtir chu anni liengkoa inthawk chun bo bawk tâng a tih.

en: This is the purpose that is purposed upon the whole earth; and this is the hand that is stretched out upon all the nations.
hmr: Chu chu a nih, hnuoi chung po poa thuruot chu; chu bawk chu a nih hnam tinrêng chunga kut phar chu.

en: For Jehovah of hosts hath purposed, and who shall annul it? and his hand is stretched out, and who shall turn it back?
hmr: Sipaihai LALPA chun a ruot ta sih a, tuin am lâkpêk a ta? A kut chu pharin a um tah a, tuin am inlâk- kîrtir a ti leh?” tiin.

en: In the year that king Ahaz died was this burden.
hmr: Lal Ahaz thi kum khan hi phurrik hi a hung um tah a.

en: Rejoice not, O Philistia, all of thee, because the rod that smote thee is broken; for out of the serpent’s root shall come forth an adder, and his fruit shall be a fiery flying serpent.
hmr: Aw Philistin ram pumpui, nanga vuokna che hmawl chu a tliek ta leiin lâwm naw: rûl zunga inthawk chun rûlhmuk a hung suok ding a ni sih a; a ra chu rûl chawk vuong thei la nîng a tih.

en: And the first-born of the poor shall feed, and the needy shall lie down in safety; and I will kill thy root with famine, and thy remnant shall be slain.
hmr: Mi rimsi nau lutîrhai chu tla diel diel tâng an ta, mi pasiehai chu himtakin bawk tâng an tih: chun, nanga zung ruok chu ṭâmin sukhlum ka ta, i ta la um sunhai chu thatin um an tih.

en: Howl, O gate; cry, O city; thou art melted away, O Philistia, all of thee; for there cometh a smoke out of the north, and there is no straggler in his ranks.
hmr: Aw kawtkhâr, khêk rak rak rawh; aw khawpui, khêk rawh; aw Philistin, i pumin, în tuihmang zo tah; hmârtienga inthawkin meikhu a hung suok sih a; an hun ruotahai chun ân hnu hrim an um ngai nawh.

en: What then shall one answer the messengers of the nation? That Jehovah hath founded Zion, and in her shall the afflicted of his people take refuge.
hmr: Philistin hnam palaihai chu iengtin am dawn ei ta le? “LALPAIN Zion chu ân ngîr a, a mihai laia rimsihai chu amaa chun tlulût an tih,” tiin nîng a tih.

en: The burden of Moab. For in a night Ar of Moab is laid waste, and brought to nought; for in a night Kir of Moab is laid waste, and brought to nought.
hmr: Moab ram phurrik chu. Zân khat kârin Moab rama Ar khuo chu suksietin a um a, iengkhawm ni loa siemin a um ta sih a; zân khat kârin Moab rama Kir khuo chu suksietin a um a, iengkhawm ni loa siemin a um ta sih a.

en: They are gone up to Bayith, and to Dibon, to the high places, to weep: Moab waileth over Nebo, and over Medeba; on all their heads is baldness, every beard is cut off.
hmr: Dibon mipui chu bâwlhmuna hai chun ṭap dingin an hang fe a, Moab- hai chun Nebo le Medeba chu an ṭapkhum rak rak a, an lu po po a kawl vawng a, khâk hmul tinrêng khawm vawin a um ta vawng a nih.

en: In their streets they gird themselves with sackcloth; on their housetops, and in their broad places, every one waileth, weeping abundantly.
hmr: An kawtthlêrahai chun saiip puon an dierkei a, an in chungahai le an tuolzâwl lienna laiahai chun mi tin chu nasataka ṭapin an khêk rak rak a.

en: And Heshbon crieth out, and Elealeh; their voice is heard even unto Jahaz: therefore the armed men of Moab cry aloud; his soul trembleth within him.
hmr: Chun, Hesbonhai khawm chu an khêk a, Eleale mihai leh; an râwl chu Jahaz khuo chen khawma an lo hriet a; chuleiin, Moab mihai râlthuoma inthuomhai chu inringtakin an khêk a; an hringna chu an phîng sûnga chun ân thin a.

en: My heart crieth out for Moab; her nobles flee unto Zoar, to Eglath-shelishi-yah: for by the ascent of Luhith with weeping they go up; for in the way of Horonaim they raise up a cry of destruction.
hmr: Moabhai leiin ka lungril chu a khêk a; an mi ṭhahai chu Zoar khuoa le Eglath-selisijah-ah an tlân a, Luhith lam tunga chun ṭap pumin an fe a nih; Horonaim lampuia chun sietna khêkin an khêk suok a nih.

en: For the waters of Nimrim shall be desolate; for the grass is withered away, the tender grass faileth, there is no green thing.
hmr: Nimrim tuihai chu suksietin a um ding a ni sih a; hlobet chu a vuoi zo a, hlobet inder thar chu a rawp a, thil hring rêng rêng chu a um ta si nawh a.

en: Therefore the abundance they have gotten, and that which they have laid up, shall they carry away over the brook of the willows.
hmr: Chuleiin, an sum la nei sunhai le an sie ṭhathai chu Phahrâm Vadung râla chun fe hmangpui an tih.

en: For the cry is gone round about the borders of Moab; the wailing thereof unto Eglaim, and the wailing thereof unto Beer-elim.
hmr: Khêkri chu Moab ramri vêlahai chun a um sih a, khêk rak rak ri chu Eglaim khuo chenin ân hriet a nih; khêk rak rak ri chu Beerelim khuo chenin ân hriet a nih.

en: For the waters of Dimon are full of blood; for I will bring yet more upon Dimon, a lion upon them of Moab that escape, and upon the remnant of the land.
hmr: Dimon tuihai chu thisenin ân pawl zo vawng sih a; Dimon chunga chun thil nasa nâwk zuol kân tlungtir ding a ni sih a, Moabhai laia tlân- suokhai chunga le, chu rama la um sunhai chunga chun sakeibaknei intlungtir ka tih.

en: Send ye the lambs for the ruler of the land from Selah to the wilderness, unto the mount of the daughter of Zion.
hmr: Ram rorêltu ta dingin berâm- tehai chu Sela khuo thlalêr tienga uma inthawk chun Zion naunu tlânga chun inphur ro.

en: For it shall be that, as wandering birds, as a scattered nest, so shall the daughters of Moab be at the fords of the Arnon.
hmr: Chuongchun, Moab naunuhai chu vate a bua inthawka rau dara vuong vuonghai angin Arnon vadung kaia chun an um ding annâwm.

en: Give counsel, execute justice; make thy shade as the night in the midst of the noonday; hide the outcasts; betray not the fugitive.
hmr: Rem mi ruotpêk la, ro mi rêlpêk rawh; i hlim chu sûn laia zân angin siem la, hnawt suoka umhai chu inbîkhmangtir rawh; tlân hmang chu inmantir naw.

en: Let mine outcasts dwell with thee; as for Moab, be thou a covert to him from the face of the destroyer. For the extortioner is brought to nought, destruction ceaseth, the oppressors are consumed out of the land.
hmr: Moabhai laia hnawt suoka umhai chu i kuomah um raw hai se, an ta dingin suksetu hmêla inthawka inbîkna ni rawh; hlêprutu chu ieng- khawm ni loa siemin a um ta sih a, suksietna a bo tah a; nêksâwrtuhai chu rama inthawk hin sukbohmangin an um tah.

en: And a throne shall be established in lovingkindness; and one shall sit thereon in truth, in the tent of David, judging, and seeking justice, and swift to do righteousness.
hmr: Chuongchun, lalṭhungpha chu lunginsietnaa sukdetin um a ta, chu chunga chun, David puon ina chun, mi pakhat, rorêlin, rorêlna fel zawng- in, thil fel inhmâwtaka thaw nghâlin, titakzetin ṭhung a tih.

en: We have heard of the pride of Moab, that he is very proud; even of his arrogancy, and his pride, and his wrath; his boastings are nought.
hmr: Moabhai chapona thu, an chapo êm êm a ni ti ei lo hriet a, an ṭawng mingemzie le an chapozie le, an lunginsenzie thu chu, an uongnahai chu iengkhawm a ni nawh.

en: Therefore shall Moab wail for Moab, every one shall wail: for the raisin-cakes of Kir-hareseth shall ye mourn, utterly stricken.
hmr: Chuleiin, Moabhai chu Moabhai chunga chun khêk rak rak an ta, mi tin chu khêk rak rak an tih: Kir-hareseth grêp inhro hlawm chu lungsetakin la ṭâng in tih.

en: For the fields of Heshbon languish, and the vine of Sibmah; the lords of the nations have broken down the choice branches thereof, which reached even unto Jazer, which wandered into the wilderness; its shoots were spread abroad, they passed over the sea.
hmr: Hesbon lohai chu a châu zo ta sih a, Sibma grêp hrui leh; hnam tin lalhai chun a kûng ṭha mihai chu an suktliek pheng phung a, Jazer khuo chen chenin ân zâm tâwl a, thlalêrah an inzâm lût a, a kauhai chu ân zâm dar sung a; tuipui chu ân zâm kai tah a.

en: Therefore I will weep with the weeping of Jazer for the vine of Sibmah; I will water thee with my tears, O Heshbon, and Elealeh: for upon thy summer fruits and upon thy harvest the battle shout is fallen.
hmr: Chuleiin, Sibma grêp hrui chu Jazer ṭain ṭâng ka tih; aw Hesbon le Eleale, ka mitthli hin buok ka ti che: i nipui rahai chunga le i bu sîk chunga chun indona ri chu a tla ta sih a.

en: And gladness is taken away, and joy out of the fruitful field; and in the vineyards there shall be no singing, neither joyful noise: no treader shall tread out wine in the presses; I have made the vintage shout to cease.
hmr: Lâwmna chu lâkpêkin a um tah; lo ṭhataka inthawk dâm chun hlimna chu lâkpêkin a um ta bawk a; grêp huonahai chun hlasak hrim hrim um ta naw nih a, ri hlimum hrim hrim um ta bawk naw ni; grêp sâwrna khurahai chun sir sâwrtu hrim hrim- in uoin sir pût ta naw ni hai a; grêp sîk khêk ri chu ka sukbo tah.

en: Wherefore my heart soundeth like a harp for Moab, and mine inward parts for Kir-heres.
hmr: Chuleiin, ka rîhai chu Moab lunginsiet leiin ṭingṭang angin ân rih a, ka phîng sûng chu Kirheres lungin- siet leiin ṭingṭang angin ân ri bawk a.

en: And it shall come to pass, when Moab presenteth himself, when he wearieth himself upon the high place, and shall come to his sanctuary to pray, that he shall not prevail.
hmr: Chun, Moab chu ân lang pha chun bâwlhmuna insuksâwla, ṭawngṭai dinga a hmun inthienga a hung pha chun hlawtling naw nih.

en: This is the word that Jehovah spake concerning Moab in time past.
hmr: Chuong chu Moab chungchâng thu LALPAIN kha hmaa a hril kha a nih.

en: But now Jehovah hath spoken, saying, Within three years, as the years of a hireling, the glory of Moab shall be brought into contempt, with all his great multitude; and the remnant shall be very small and of no account.
hmr: Tu ruok hin chu LALPAIN, “In- hlawfa kum tiema kum thum sûngin Moab ropuina chu, a mipui nasatak- hai pumin hmusituma inumtirin um a ta, a la um sunhai chu tlâwmterek el, hril khawp lo nîng an tih,” tiin a hril tah.

en: The burden of Damascus. Behold, Damascus is taken away from being a city, and it shall be a ruinous heap.
hmr: Damaska khaw phurrik chu. Ngai ta, Damaska chu khaw- pui ni ta lo dingin lâk hmang a ni tah; chuongchun, in chim khâwm el ni tâng a tih.

en: The cities of Aroer are forsaken; they shall be for flocks, which shall lie down, and none shall make them afraid.
hmr: Aroer khuohai chu tlânsanin a um tah; berâm ruolhai umna ding ni el a tih; chuong chu bawk an ta, tukhawma sukṭi naw ni hai.

en: And the fortress shall cease from Ephraim, and the kingdom from Damascus, and the remnant of Syria; they shall be as the glory of the children of Israel, saith Jehovah of hosts.
hmr: Ephraima inthawka kulpui chu bo a ta, Damaskaa inthawkin ram chu bo a tih; Suria ram la um sunhai khawm chu bo a ta, Israel thlahai ropuina ang chauin um an tih, sipaihai LALPAIN a tih.

en: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the glory of Jacob shall be made thin, and the fatness of his flesh shall wax lean.
hmr: Chu nia chun, Jakob ropuina chu sukchêrin um a ta, a tisa thâuna chu hung chêr tâng a tih.

en: And it shall be as when the harvestman gathereth the standing grain, and his arm reapeth the ears; yea, it shall be as when one gleaneth ears in the valley of Rephaim.
hmr: Chuongchun, bu sîktupain bu a lâk a, a vuihai chu kuta a ât bawng ang el hi nîng a tih; anih, Rephaim ruoma mihaiin buvui hmu ṭhel an rût ang el hi nîng a tih.

en: Yet there shall be left therein gleanings, as the shaking of an olive-tree, two or three berries in the top of the uppermost bough, four or five in the outmost branches of a fruitful tree, saith Jehovah, the God of Israel.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, oliv thing vuok hnunga a zikpui insângtak lêra ra pahni pathum amanih, thing ratak zâr seitaka hai pali panga amanih a um hlak ang hin chutaka chun hmu ṭhel rût ding la um a tih, LALPA Israelhai Pathien chun a tih.

en: In that day shall men look unto their Maker, and their eyes shall have respect to the Holy One of Israel.
hmr: Chu nia chun miin anni siemtu tieng en tâng an ta, an mithai chun Israelhai Mi Inthieng chu inza tâng a tih.

en: And they shall not look to the altars, the work of their hands; neither shall they have respect to that which their fingers have made, either the Asherim, or the sun-images.
hmr: Mâichâm anni kut suok tieng chu en ta naw nih a, anni kuta siem Asera amanih, nisa limhai amani khawm inza ta naw ni hai.

en: In that day shall their strong cities be as the forsaken places in the wood and on the mountain top, which were forsaken from before the children of Israel; and it shall be a desolation.
hmr: Chu nia chun an khaw dettakhai chu rampui le tlâng sîpa hmun tlân- san hnung, Israel thlahai hmaa an tlânsan hnung ang khan nîng a tih; chuongchun, hmun râusan ni tâng a tih.

en: For thou hast forgotten the God of thy salvation, and hast not been mindful of the rock of thy strength; therefore thou plantest pleasant plants, and settest it with strange slips.
hmr: Pathien i sandamtu i theinghil a, i hrâtna lungpui chu i hriet zing si nawh a; chuleiin, kûng mawitak takhai i phun hlak a, a sûnga chun kau danglamtak takhai i sunbûr fur hlak a;

en: In the day of thy planting thou hedgest it in, and in the morning thou makest thy seed to blossom; but the harvest fleeth away in the day of grief and of desperate sorrow.
hmr: i phun ni chun în huon vêl hlak a, zîngkâr chun i thil chi chu i sukpâr hlak; nisienlakhawm, a ra lo chu lungngaina le natna nasatak nia chun a bo el hlak.

en: Ah, the uproar of many peoples, that roar like the roaring of the seas; and the rushing of nations, that rush like the rushing of mighty waters!
hmr: A mipui tamtak inri dur dur, tuisuoriethai inri dur dur anga inri dur durhai le hnam tin inri hum hum, tui nasatak inri hum hum anga inri hum humhai chu aw!

en: The nations shall rush like the rushing of many waters: but he shall rebuke them, and they shall flee far off, and shall be chased as the chaff of the mountains before the wind, and like the whirling dust before the storm.
hmr: Hnam tin chu tui tamtak inri hum hum angin inri hum hum an tih; nisienlakhawm, ama chun kâwk a ta, hlatakah tlân hmang an ta, tlânga busi thli ilên ang le pilvut thlipui imût vir mup mup angin hnawtin um an tih.

en: At eventide, behold, terror; and before the morning they are not. This is the portion of them that despoil us, and the lot of them that rob us.
hmr: Zântieng chun ngai ta, thil râp- thlâktak a um a nih; chun, khaw var hmain an um ta nawh. Chu chu râl- lâka mi lâkpêktuhai chan a na, a mîn rûkpêktuhai puol chu a ni bawk a.

en: Ah, the land of the rustling of wings, which is beyond the rivers of Ethiopia;
hmr: A thla zâp ri hum hum ram, Ethiopia rama vadungte râla um, tuipuiah, tui chunga luong– lawngahai palaihai tirtu chu!

en: that sendeth ambassadors by the sea, even in vessels of papyrus upon the waters, saying, Go, ye swift messengers, to a nation tall and smooth, to a people terrible from their beginning onward, a nation that meteth out and treadeth down, whose land the rivers divide!
hmr: Thangko hrâttakhai, hnam in- sâng thler thlawr innâmtak kuomah, an suok phuta inthawka tu chena mi ṭiumtakhai kuoma chun fe ro; chu hnam chun ram an sem hlak a, an sir thlûk bawk hlak a, an ram chu vadunghai chun a semdar a nih.

en: All ye inhabitants of the world, and ye dwellers on the earth, when an ensign is lifted up on the mountains, see ye; and when the trumpet is blown, hear ye.
hmr: Khawvêla um po po le leihnuoi hluohai, tlângahai inchikna an târ suok phaleh en ro; tawtawrâwt an mût pha chun ngai ro.

en: For thus hath Jehovah said unto me, I will be still, and I will behold in my dwelling-place, like clear heat in sunshine, like a cloud of dew in the heat of harvest.
hmr: LALPA chun ka kuomah hieng ang hin a hril a nih, “Um ṭawk ṭawk ka ta, ka umnaa hin thlîr zing ka tih; nisa sat laia khaw lum inthieng vel vul ang le, bu sîk khaw lum laia daidaw sûmhu ang hin,” tiin.

en: For before the harvest, when the blossom is over, and the flower becometh a ripening grape, he will cut off the sprigs with pruning-hooks, and the spreading branches will he take away and cut down.
hmr: Grêp lo hun hmaa, a pâr a rêm a, a pâr chu grêp puoma a hung inchang pha chun, a kauhai tê chu theikûng ât bawngnain a ât bawng ding a ni sih a; a kau inzâm darhai chu la hmangin ât bawng bawk a tih.

en: They shall be left together unto the ravenous birds of the mountains, and to the beasts of the earth; and the ravenous birds shall summer upon them, and all the beasts of the earth shall winter upon them.
hmr: Chuongchu tlânga vate hnukin- râwlhai le hnuoia sahai ta dingin mâksanin um an tih, chuongchun, vate hnukinrâwlhai chun anni chu nipui sûngin fâng an ta, hnuoia sahai po po chun thlasik sûngin fâng an tih

en: In that time shall a present be brought unto Jehovah of hosts from a people tall and smooth, even from a people terrible from their beginning onward, a nation that meteth out and treadeth down, whose land the rivers divide, to the place of the name of Jehovah of hosts, the mount Zion.
hmr: Chu pha chun sipaihai LALPA hming umna hmun Zion tlânga chun, sipaihai LALPA kuoma pêk dingin mi insâng thler thlawr innâmtakhai kuoma inthawkin, an suok phuta inthawka tu chena mi ṭiumtakhai kuoma inthawk chu, lâwmman hung chawi an tih; chu hnam chun ram an sem hlak a, an sir thlûk bawk hlak a, an ram chu vadunghai chun a semdar a nih.

en: The burden of Egypt. Behold, Jehovah rideth upon a swift cloud, and cometh unto Egypt: and the idols of Egypt shall tremble at his presence; and the heart of Egypt shall melt in the midst of it.
hmr: Aigupta ram phurrik chu, Ngai ta, LALPA chu sûm hrâttak chunga chuongin Aigupta ram a hung tlung tah ie! Aigupta ram milimhai chu a hmaa chun inthin dar dar an ta, Aigupta mihai lungril chu an sûnga chun intuihmang el a tih.

en: And I will stir up the Egyptians against the Egyptians: and they shall fight every one against his brother, and every one against his neighbor; city against city, and kingdom against kingdom.
hmr: Chun, Aigupta mihai chu Aigup- ta mi vêk thaw dingin chawktho ka ta; chuongchun, mi tinin mâni unau thawin, mi tinin mâni tuolbâwmhai thawin, indo an tih; khuo le khuo inthâwng an ta, ram le ram inthâwng an tih.

en: And the spirit of Egypt shall fail in the midst of it; and I will destroy the counsel thereof: and they shall seek unto the idols, and to the charmers, and to them that have familiar spirits, and to the wizards.
hmr: Chuongchun, Aigupta mihai thlarau chu an sûnga chun ieng- khawm ni loa siemin um a ta; an remruot chu suksieng ka tih: chuong- chun, milimhai le, aikeithiemhai le, khawhri aisânthiem zâwlhai le, dawi- thiemhai chu râwn an tih.

en: And I will give over the Egyptians into the hand of a cruel lord; and a fierce king shall rule over them, saith the Lord, Jehovah of hosts.
hmr: Chun, Aigupta mihai chu hotu nunsetak kutah inhlân ka ta; lal nunsetakin an chungah ro rêl tâng a tih, Lalpa, sipaihai LALPA chun a tih.

en: And the waters shall fail from the sea, and the river shall be wasted and become dry.
hmr: Chun, tuipui tuihai chu kang a ta, vadunghai chu luong hmangin hung kang intan tâng a tih.

en: And the rivers shall become foul; the streams of Egypt shall be diminished and dried up; the reeds and flags shall wither away.
hmr: Vadunghai chu hung rimsieng a ta; Aigupta ram tui luonghai chu hung kang deu deu a ta, kang intan el a tih: phairuonghai le tuihnârhai chu ṭâwl zo a tih.

en: The meadows by the Nile, by the brink of the Nile, and all the sown fields of the Nile, shall become dry, be driven away, and be no more.
hmr: Nile vadung kâwla, Nile vadung pang ngeia, ran tlatna phûlhai le, Nile vadung kâwla thil chînghai po po chu hung ṭâwl zo a ta, lên hmangin um an ta, um ta naw nih.

en: And the fishers shall lament, and all they that cast angle into the Nile shall mourn, and they that spread nets upon the waters shall languish.
hmr: Nga mantuhai khawm chu ṭap an ta. Nile vadunga ngakuoi inchie hlak- hai po po chu an âwm inchum an ta, tuia lênkhang kei hlakhai chu châu tâng an tih.

en: Moreover they that work in combed flax, and they that weave white cloth, shall be confounded.
hmr: Chu naw khawm chu ziza zai inhmi them mihai le puon ngo khâwng mihai chu muolpho an tih.

en: And the pillars of Egypt shall be broken in pieces; all they that work for hire shall be grieved in soul.
hmr: Chun, a lung banhai chu suknâwiin um a ta, inhlawfa hlakhai po po chu an lungrilin lungngai an tih.

en: The princes of Zoan are utterly foolish; the counsel of the wisest counsellors of Pharaoh is become brutish: how say ye unto Pharaoh, I am the son of the wise, the son of ancient kings?
hmr: Zoan khuoa mi lienhai chu an invêt ngawt el; Pharao remruottu vartakhai remruot chu sa remruot ang el a hung ni tah; Pharao kuomah, “Mi var naupa, tienlai lalhai naupa ka nih,” iengtiziea ti hlak am in nih a?

en: Where then are thy wise men? and let them tell thee now; and let them know what Jehovah of hosts hath purposed concerning Egypt.
hmr: I mi varhai chu khâw lai am? Anni chun hril nghâl raw hai se che; Aigupta ram chunga thil tlung ding, sipaihai LALPA ruothai chu, hre raw se.

en: The princes of Zoan are become fools, the princes of Memphis are deceived; they have caused Egypt to go astray, that are the corner-stone of her tribes.
hmr: Zoan khuoa mi lienhai chu mi invêt an hung ni tah a, Noph khuoa mi lienhai chu hlêmin an um tah: Aigupta hnamhai kia lunghai chun Aiguptahai chu an invâkhmangtir tah.

en: Jehovah hath mingled a spirit of perverseness in the midst of her; and they have caused Egypt to go astray in every work thereof, as a drunken man staggereth in his vomit.
hmr: LALPA chun Aigupta mihai laia chun kâwmâwsietna thlarau ân umtir tah; chuongchun, zu inrui chu ama luoka a pêm a pêm ang hin Aigupta mihai chu an sinthaw tinrêngah an infe kâwitir tah a.

en: Neither shall there be for Egypt any work, which head or tail, palm-branch or rush, may do.
hmr: Aiguptahai dingin luin amanih, meiin amanih, intûm kauin amanih, thielkuongin amania thawpêk thei um ta bawk naw nih.

en: In that day shall the Egyptians be like unto women; and they shall tremble and fear because of the shaking of the hand of Jehovah of hosts, which he shaketh over them.
hmr: Chu nia chun Aigupta mihai chu nuhmei ruol ang nîng an ta, sipai- hai LALPA kut thin chu an chunga a thin leiin inthinin ṭîng an tih.

en: And the land of Judah shall become a terror unto Egypt; every one to whom mention is made thereof shall be afraid, because of the purpose of Jehovah of hosts, which he purposeth against it.
hmr: Juda rama umhai chu Aigupta mihai ta ding chun râpthlâktak hung ni tâng an ta, an hming an lamna taphawthai chun ṭîng an ta, an chunga tlung ding sipaihai LALPA thuruot lei chun.

en: In that day there shall be five cities in the land of Egypt that speak the language of Canaan, and swear to Jehovah of hosts; one shall be called The city of destruction.
hmr: Chu nia chun Kanaan mihai ṭawnga ṭawng le, sipaihai LALPA kuoma ṭawng inkhâma thu tiem hlakhai chu, Aigupta ram sûngah khaw panga um a ta; pakhat chu Bohmangna Khuo tîng an tih.

en: In that day shall there be an altar to Jehovah in the midst of the land of Egypt, and a pillar at the border thereof to Jehovah.
hmr: Chu nia chun Aigupta ram laia chun LALPA ta dingin mâichâm um a ta, a ramria chun LALPA ta dingin lungphun um a tih.

en: And it shall be for a sign and for a witness unto Jehovah of hosts in the land of Egypt; for they shall cry unto Jehovah because of oppressors, and he will send them a saviour, and a defender, and he will deliver them.
hmr: Chu chu Aigupta rama sipaihai LALPA ta ding chun inchikna le hrietna nîng a tih, nêksâwrtuhai leiin LALPA chu an la ko ding a ni sih a; chuongchun, ama chun sandamtu le humhimtu tir a ta, ama chun annirawi chu sansuok a tih.

en: And Jehovah shall be known to Egypt, and the Egyptians shall know Jehovah in that day; yea, they shall worship with sacrifice and oblation, and shall vow a vow unto Jehovah, and shall perform it.
hmr: Chuongchun, LALPA chu Aigupta mihai ihriet ni tâng a ta, Aigupta mihai chun chu nia chun LALPA chu hre tâng an tih; anih, inthawina le thilpêkin chibai bûk an tih, LALPA kuoma chun thu tiem an ta, muolsuo bawk an tih.

en: And Jehovah will smite Egypt, smiting and healing; and they shall return unto Jehovah, and he will be entreated of them, and will heal them.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun Aigupta mihai chu vuong a ta, sukdam bawk a tih: chuongchun, LALPA kuomah kîr nâwk an ta, ama chu anni ngên thlûk- in um a ta, anni chu sukdam a tih.

en: In that day shall there be a highway out of Egypt to Assyria, and the Assyrian shall come into Egypt, and the Egyptian into Assyria; and the Egyptians shall worship with the Assyrians.
hmr: Chu nia chun Aigupta rama inthawkin Assuria ram chenin lam- lien um a ta; chuongchun, Assuria mihai chu Aigupta ramah fêng an ta, Aigupta mihai chu Assuria ramah fe bawk an tih; Aigupta mihai chun Assuria mihai leh Pathien chu chibai bûk hmunkhat tâng an tih.

en: In that day shall Israel be the third with Egypt and with Assyria, a blessing in the midst of the earth;
hmr: Chu nia chun Israelhai chu Aiguptahai le Assuriahai pathumtu nîng an ta, hnuoi lailia hin malsâwm- na nîng an tih;

en: for that Jehovah of hosts hath blessed them, saying, Blessed be Egypt my people, and Assyria the work of my hands, and Israel mine inheritance.
hmr: sipaihai LALPA chun, “Ka mi Aiguptahai le ka kutsuok Assuria- hai le ka rochan Israelhai chu malsâwmin um raw se,” tiin mal a sâwm sih a.

en: The word that Isaiah the son of Amoz saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem.
hmr: Amoz naupa Isaiin Judahai le Jerusalem chungchâng thu a hmu chu.

en: And it shall come to pass in the latter days, that the mountain of Jehovah’s house shall be established on the top of the mountains, and shall be exalted above the hills; and all nations shall flow unto it.
hmr: Ni nuhnungahai chun LALPA in umna tlâng chu tlâng lien chungahai chun sukdetin um a ta, tlâng chînhai chunga chun dawm sângin um bawk a ta, chutaka chun hnam tinrênghai chu fe nguoi nguoi an tih.

en: And many peoples shall go and say, Come ye, and let us go up to the mountain of Jehovah, to the house of the God of Jacob; and he will teach us of his ways, and we will walk in his paths: for out of Zion shall go forth the law, and the word of Jehovah from Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, chi tamtakhai chu fêng an ta, “Hung unla, LALPA tlângah, Jakob Pathien ina chun, hang fêng ei tiu; chuongchun, ama chun a lampui chanchinhai chu mîn chûktir a ta, a lampuiahai chun fêng ei tih,” tîng an tih. Ziona inthawk chun dân thu chu a hung suok ding a ni sih a. LALPA thu chu Jerusalema inthawkin a hung suok ding a nih.

en: And he will judge between the nations, and will decide concerning many peoples; and they shall beat their swords into plowshares, and their spears into pruning-hooks; nation shall not lift up sword against nation, neither shall they learn war any more.
hmr: Ama chun hnam tin kârah ro rêl a ta, chi tamtak khawm kâwk bawk a tih; chun, an kâwlhnâmhai chu hnuoi inletna hmawr zumahai sut an ta, an feihai chu thei kûng âtbawngna chem inkuoiahai sut an ta, hnam dangin hnam dang chungah kâwlhnâm inlet ta naw nih a, indo dân khawm inchûk ta bawk naw ni hai.

en: O house of Jacob, come ye, and let us walk in the light of Jehovah.
hmr: Aw Jakob sûnghai, hung unla, LALPA vara hin lêng ei tiu khai.

en: For thou hast forsaken thy people the house of Jacob, because they are filled with customs from the east, and are soothsayers like the Philistines, and they strike hands with the children of foreigners.
hmr: Khawsak tienga dân hung suokhaiin an hung sip a, Philistin mihai anga aisânthiemhai an nih a, ram dang mi nauhai leh kut le kut an inben leiin, i mi Jakob sûnghai chu i mâksan ta sih a.

en: And their land is full of silver and gold, neither is there any end of their treasures; their land also is full of horses, neither is there any end of their chariots.
hmr: An ram chu tangka le râng- kachakin a sip a, an sumhai chu tiem sêng ruol a ni bawk nawh; an ram chu sakawrin a sip a, an tawlailîr- hai chu tiem sêng ruol an ni bawk nawh.

en: Their land also is full of idols; they worship the work of their own hands, that which their own fingers have made.
hmr: An ram chu milimin a sip a, anni kuta thaw suok, anni kutpârhaia siem chu an biek hlak.

en: And the mean man is bowed down, and the great man is brought low: therefore forgive them not.
hmr: Mi chînhai chu sukhnuoiin an um a, mi lienhai chu suktlâwmin an um bawk a, chuleiin, anni chu ngaidam naw rawh.

en: Enter into the rock, and hide thee in the dust, from before the terror of Jehovah, and from the glory of his majesty.
hmr: LALPA ṭiumnaa inthawk le a mawina ropuinaa inthawk chun lung- puia chun lût unla, pilvutah inbi- hmang ro.

en: The lofty looks of man shall be brought low, and the haughtiness of men shall be bowed down, and Jehovah alone shall be exalted in that day.
hmr: Mihriem inditnahai chu suk- tlâwmin um a ta, mihai chapona chu sukhnuoiin um a tih; chu nia chun LALPA chau chu chawisângin um a tih.

en: For there shall be a day of Jehovah of hosts upon all that is proud and haughty, and upon all that is lifted up; and it shall be brought low;
hmr: Sipaihai LALPA ni chu inngai- sâng le, chapo po po chunga le chawisânga um po pohai chunga chun a la um ding a ni sih a; chuongchun, suktlâwmin um a tih;

en: and upon all the cedars of Lebanon, that are high and lifted up, and upon all the oaks of Bashan,
hmr: Lebanon tlânga sidar thing insângtak le chawisânga umhai po po chunga dâm, Basan rama thingsaisuo po po chunga dâm;

en: and upon all the high mountains, and upon all the hills that are lifted up,
hmr: tlâng lien insângtak chunga dâm, tlâng chîn dawm sânga um po po chunga dâm;

en: and upon every lofty tower, and upon every fortified wall,
hmr: in insâng insângtak tak chunga dâm, kul tlângpui bang nei po po chunga dâm;

en: and upon all the ships of Tarshish, and upon all pleasant imagery.
hmr: Tarsis lawng lien po po chunga dâm, thil tehlêm ditum po po chunga dâm khawm la um a tih.

en: And the loftiness of man shall be bowed down, and the haughtiness of men shall be brought low; and Jehovah alone shall be exalted in that day.
hmr: Mihriem inditnahai chu suk- hnuoiin um a ta, mihai chapona chu suktlâwmin um bawk a tih; chu nia chun LALPA chau chu chawisângin um a tih.

en: And the idols shall utterly pass away.
hmr: Chun, milimhai chu bohmang dai an tih.

en: And men shall go into the caves of the rocks, and into the holes of the earth, from before the terror of Jehovah, and from the glory of his majesty, when he ariseth to shake mightily the earth.
hmr: Chun, hnuoi hi nasatak taka sukhnîng dinga a tho pha chun, LALPA ṭiumnaa inthawk le a mawina ropuinaa inthawk chun mihai chu lungpui pûkahai le hnuoi kuoahai chun lût an tih.

en: In that day men shall cast away their idols of silver, and their idols of gold, which have been made for them to worship, to the moles and to the bats;
hmr: Chuong niahai chun mihai chun an tangka milimhai le an rângkachak milimhai, biek dinga an insiem- pêkhai chu, buikelet kuoma le bâk kuoma chun pei an ta,

en: to go into the caverns of the rocks, and into the clefts of the ragged rocks, from before the terror of Jehovah, and from the glory of his majesty, when he ariseth to shake mightily the earth.
hmr: hnuoi hi nasatak taka sukhnîng dinga a tho pha, LALPA ṭiumnaa in- thawk le, a mawina ropuinaa inthawk chun, lungpui pûkahai le râwl lungpui kakahai chun lût an tih.

en: Cease ye from man, whose breath is in his nostrils; for wherein is he to be accounted of?
hmr: An hnâr chaua thuok um, mihriem ring hi bânsan ta ro, ieng kawng âm ring tlâk an ni hrim leh?

en: In the year that Tartan came unto Ashdod, when Sargon the king of Assyria sent him, and he fought against Ashdod and took it;
hmr: Assuria lal Sargon tirin Tartan chu Asdod khuoah a hung a, Asdod khuo chu a thawh a, a lâk kum khan;

en: at that time Jehovah spake by Isaiah the son of Amoz, saying, Go, and loose the sackcloth from off thy loins, and put thy shoe from off thy foot. And he did so, walking naked and barefoot.
hmr: chu lai chun LALPAIN Amoz naupa Isai bauin, “Fe la, i kâwnga saiip puon kha hlîp la, i kea kekawk kha sie rawh,” tiin a hril a. Chuong- chun, chuong ang chun a thawh a, saruok le kekawk bun loin a fe a fe tah a.

en: And Jehovah said, Like as my servant Isaiah hath walked naked and barefoot three years for a sign and a wonder concerning Egypt and concerning Ethiopia;
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun, “Ka siehlaw Isai hi Aigupta mihai chunga le Ethiopia mihai chunga thilmak le inchiknaa dingin kum thum sûnga saruok le kekawk bun loa a fe ang hin,

en: so shall the king of Assyria lead away the captives of Egypt, and the exiles of Ethiopia, young and old, naked and barefoot, and with buttocks uncovered, to the shame of Egypt.
hmr: Assuria lal chun Aiguptahai manhai le Ethiopiahai salhai chu, a nuhmei a pasalin, saruok le kekawk bun lo le mawng inlangin Aiguptahai muolphona dingin ṭhuoi hmang a tih.

en: And they shall be dismayed and confounded, because of Ethiopia their expectation, and of Egypt their glory.
hmr: Chuongchun, an beisei tak Ethiopia le an ropuina tak Aigupta mihai lei chun lunginzîngtak le muolphotakin um tâng an tih.

en: And the inhabitant of this coast-land shall say in that day, Behold, such is our expectation, whither we fled for help to be delivered from the king of Assyria: and we, how shall we escape?
hmr: Chuongchun, chu nia chun hi tuisuoriet panga mi hin, ‘Ngai ta, ka beiseitak, Assuria lala inthawka mi sanhim dinga mi ṭhangpuitu dinga ei tlânna chu, hieng hi a ni ta sih a, eini hi iengtin am tlân suok ei ta?’ la tîng an tih,” a ta.

en: The burden of the wilderness of the sea. As whirlwinds in the South sweep through, it cometh from the wilderness, from a terrible land.
hmr: Tuipui thlalêr phurrik chu. Sim rama thlivir a fe thlengin thlalêra inthawkin, ram ṭiumtaka inthawk chun, a hung ie.

en: A grievous vision is declared unto me; the treacherous man dealeth treacherously, and the destroyer destroyeth. Go up, O Elam; besiege, O Media; all the sighing thereof have I made to cease.
hmr: Inlârna khirkhântak el ka kuomah inhriettir a ni tah; vervêktaka thawtu chun vervêktakin a thawh a, rawktu chun a rawk a. Aw Elam mihai, hang fe ro; aw Media mihai, inhuol ro; an inrûmna po po chu ka sukbo vawng tah.

en: Therefore are my loins filled with anguish; pangs have taken hold upon me, as the pangs of a woman in travail: I am pained so that I cannot hear; I am dismayed so that I cannot see.
hmr: Chuleiin, ka kâwnghai hi natna nasatakin a sip a, nuhmei nau invawi natna angin natnain nasatakin a mi man tah; naa hre thei naw khawp hielin na ka tuor a; khaw hmu thei lo khawp hielin ka lunginzîng a.

en: My heart fluttereth, horror hath affrighted me; the twilight that I desired hath been turned into trembling unto me.
hmr: Ka lungril hi ân thuok hlawp hlawp a, thil râpthlâktakin a mi suklâu a; zântieng dei ka nghâkhla hlak kha ka ta dingin inthinnaah ân chang a,

en: They prepare the table, they set the watch, they eat, they drink: rise up, ye princes, anoint the shield.
hmr: Dawkân chu an buotsai a, râlvêngtu chu an invêngtir a, an fâk a, an dâwn a; mi lienhai, tho unla phaw kha hriek nâl ro.

en: For thus hath the Lord said unto me, Go, set a watchman; let him declare what he seeth:
hmr: LALPA chun ka kuomah hieng ang hin a hril a nih, “Fe la, râlvêngtu invêngtir rawh; ama chun a thil hmu chu hril raw se.

en: and when he seeth a troop, horsemen in pairs, a troop of asses, a troop of camels, he shall hearken diligently with much heed.
hmr: Chun, sipai pâwl dâm, sakawr chung chuong a kawp peia fe dâm, sabengtung pâwl dâm, sanghâwngsei pâwl dâm, a hmu pha chun ngun- takin ngai kieu a tih,” tiin.

en: And he cried as a lion: O Lord, I stand continually upon the watch-tower in the day-time, and am set in my ward whole nights;
hmr: Chun, ama chu sakeibaknei angin a khêk a, “Aw Lalpa, sûna chun râlvêng bûk chunga hin ka ngîr rawp a, zânkhawvârin ka vêngnaa hin i mîn umtir rawp a;

en: and, behold, here cometh a troop of men, horsemen in pairs. And he answered and said, Fallen, fallen is Babylon; and all the graven images of her gods are broken unto the ground.
hmr: ngai ta, hitaka hin mihriem pâwl, sakawr chung chuong a kawp peia fe an hung ie,” tiin. Chun, ama bawk chun, “Babulon khuo chu a tlâwm tah, a tlâwm tah; an thiempu- hai milim siem fâwmhai po po chu hnuoia suknâwiin a um tah,” tiin a dawn a.

en: O thou my threshing, and the grain of my floor! that which I have heard from Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, have I declared unto you.
hmr: Aw ka bu vuok sa, ka hrizâwla bu; sipaihai LALPA Israelhai Pa- thiena inthawka ka hriet chu ka hril cheu a ni hi.

en: The burden of Dumah. One calleth unto me out of Seir, Watchman, what of the night? Watchman, what of the night?
hmr: Duma phurrik chu. Miin Seir tlânga inthawkin an mi ko a, “Râl- vêngtu, zân hi iengtin am a ni tah a? Râlvêngtu, zân hi iengtin am a ni tah a?” tiin.

en: The watchman said, The morning cometh, and also the night: if ye will inquire, inquire ye: turn ye, come.
hmr: Râlvêngtu chun, “Zîngkâr a hung ni ding a ni tah, zân khawm: in indawn nuom chun indawn ro: nghakîr nâwk unla, hung ro,” a ta.

en: The burden upon Arabia. In the forest in Arabia shall ye lodge, O ye caravans of Dedanites.
hmr: Arabia ram chunga phurrik chu. Aw Dedanhai khuol inzin pâwl tinhai, Arabia rama ramhnuoiah riek in tih. Dangchâr kuoma chun tui an hung lâk a.

en: Unto him that was thirsty they brought water; the inhabitants of the land of Tema did meet the fugitives with their bread.
hmr: Tema rama umhai chun an buin tlân hmanghai chu an tuok a.

en: For they fled away from the swords, from the drawn sword, and from the bent bow, and from the grievousness of war.
hmr: Kâwlhnâmhaia inthawkin, kâwlhnâm phawisahaia inthawkin le, thalngul kuoisaa inthawk le indona nasataka inthawka tlân hmang an ni sih a.

en: For thus hath the Lord said unto me, Within a year, according to the years of a hireling, all the glory of Kedar shall fail;
hmr: Lalpa chun hieng ang hin ka kuomah a hril sih a, “Inhlawfa kum tiema kum khat sûngin Kedarhai ropuina po po chu bo zo vawng a ta,

en: and the residue of the number of the archers, the mighty men of the children of Kedar, shall be few; for Jehovah, the God of Israel, hath spoken it.
hmr: thal kâp mi, Kedar thlahai laia mi hrât tak la um sunhai chu, tlâwmte nîng an tih: LALPA Israelhai Pathien chun chu chu a hril ta sih a,” tiin.

en: The burden of the valley of vision. What aileth thee now, that thou art wholly gone up to the housetops?
hmr: Inlârna ruom phurrik chu. Ieng am in ti a ni leh, in chunga dâm in lâwn vawng leh?

en: O thou that art full of shoutings, a tumultuous city, a joyous town; thy slain are not slain with the sword, neither are they dead in battle.
hmr: Aw khêk ria sip, khawpui sa mur mur, khaw hlimtak, i sûnga an that- hai chu kâwlhnâma that an ni nawh a, indonaa thi an ni bawk nawh.

en: All thy rulers fled away together, they were bound by the archers; all that were found of thee were bound together; they fled afar off.
