hmr: I rorêltuhai po po chu an tlân hmang tâwl a, thal kâp mihai khuop- in an um a; i ta an hmu po po chu khuop hlawmin an um a, hlataka inthawka hung tlân hmanghai chu.

en: Therefore said I, Look away from me, I will weep bitterly; labor not to comfort me for the destruction of the daughter of my people.
hmr: Chuleiin, kei chun, “Mi en loin, khingtieng en ro, ka ṭap rak rak ding a nih; ka mihai naunuhai râllâka an lâk thua chun mi thlêm inkhaw nuom naw ro,” ka tih a.

en: For it is a day of discomfiture, and of treading down, and of perplexity, from the Lord, Jehovah of hosts, in the valley of vision; a breaking down of the walls, and a crying to the mountains.
hmr: LALPA, sipaihai LALPAA in- thawk chun, inlârna ruoma hin buoina le sirdena le lunginzîngna ni a ni sih a; kulpui bang suksietna le tlânghai kona chu.

en: And Elam bare the quiver, with chariots of men and horsemen; and Kir uncovered the shield.
hmr: Chuongchun, Elam mihai chun thal bâwm an chawi a, mihriem chuongna tawlailîrhai le sakawr chung chuong mihai leh; Kir mihai chun phaw tuomna chu an sût a.

en: And it came to pass, that thy choicest valleys were full of chariots, and the horsemen set themselves in array at the gate.
hmr: Chun, i ruom ṭhatakhai chu taw- lailîrhaiin a sip tah a, sakawr chung chuong mihai chu kul kawtkhâr bula chun an intlim hmur a.

en: And he took away the covering of Judah; and thou didst look in that day to the armor in the house of the forest.
hmr: Chun, Judahai inkhumna chu a lâk hmang a; chu nia chun rampui hmuna râl inthuomna chu in en tah a.

en: And ye saw the breaches of the city of David, that they were many; and ye gathered together the waters of the lower pool;
hmr: David khaw kul a se laihai chu in en bawk a; a tam ti in hriet a, chun, dîl thlanghnung lem tuihai chu in inluong khâwmtir tah a.

en: and ye numbered the houses of Jerusalem, and ye brake down the houses to fortify the wall;
hmr: Chun, Jerusalem inhai in tiem a, kulpui bang siem ṭhatna dingin inhai chu in ṭhiek a.

en: ye made also a reservoir between the two walls for the water of the old pool. But ye looked not unto him that had done this, neither had ye respect unto him that purposed it long ago.
hmr: Dîl hlui tui umna dingin kulpui pahni inkâra chun tui intling khâwm- na in siem a; nisienlakhawm, chuong thawtu tieng chu in en si nawh a, inhmaa lo siemtu chu in ngaisak bawk nawh.

en: And in that day did the Lord, Jehovah of hosts, call to weeping, and to mourning, and to baldness, and to girding with sackcloth:
hmr: Chu nia chun LALPA, sipaihai LALPA chun, ṭap ding le, âwm inchum ding le, lu sukkawl ding le, saiip puon dierkei dingin a ko a;

en: and, behold, joy and gladness, slaying oxen and killing sheep, eating flesh and drinking wine: Let us eat and drink, for to-morrow we shall die.
hmr: nisienlakhawm, ngai ta, hlimna le lâwmna dâm, bâwng thatna le berâm thatna dâm, sa fâkna le uoin dâwnna dâm a um ta lem a. “Fain dâwn ei tiu khai, zinga chun ei thi el ding a ni sih a,” an tih a.

en: And Jehovah of hosts revealed himself in mine ears, Surely this iniquity shall not be forgiven you till ye die, saith the Lord, Jehovah of hosts.
hmr: Chuongchun, sipaihai LALPA chun ka naah ân hriettir a, “Mathei- loin hi suolna hi in thi hmakhat chun nangni laia hi sukfai ni ta naw nih, LALPA, sipaihai LALPA chun a tih,” tiin.

en: Thus saith the Lord, Jehovah of hosts, Go, get thee unto this treasurer, even unto Shebna, who is over the house, and say,
hmr: LALPA, sipaihai LALPA chun, hieng ang hin a tih, “Fe la, hi sum enkawltu hrep kuoma hin, Sebnaa, lal in chunga hotua um ngei kuoma chun fe rawh.

en: What doest thou here? and whom hast thou here, that thou hast hewed thee out here a sepulchre? hewing him out a sepulchre on high, graving a habitation for himself in the rock!
hmr: Chun, a kuomah hieng ang hin hril rawh: Hitaka hin ieng am i thawh a? Hitaka hin tuhai am i nei a, thlân hi i kerkuok kher a ni leh? Nangma ta dingin insângtakah thlân i kerkuoh a, i ta dinga lungpuia umna i siem hrim hi!

en: Behold, Jehovah, like a strong man, will hurl thee away violently; yea, he will wrap thee up closely.
hmr: Ngai ta, LALPA chun mi hrâtna a pei angin pei rak a ti che; anih, a fûnin fûn tlat a ti che.

en: He will surely wind thee round and round, and toss thee like a ball into a large country; there shalt thou die, and there shall be the chariots of thy glory, thou shame of thy lord’s house.
hmr: Ama chun matheiloin thil hlûm angin sukvir a ti cheh a, ram lientak- ah vawr lût a ti che; chutaka chun thîng i ta, chutaka bawk chun, nang mâni lal insûng sukmuolphotupa, i ropuina tawlailîrhai chu um a tih.

en: And I will thrust thee from thine office; and from thy station shalt thou be pulled down.
hmr: I sinthawnaa inthawk chun hnawt suok ka ti cheh a, ama chun i hotu ninaa inthawk chu hnûk thlâng a ti che.

en: And it shall come to pass in that day, that I will call my servant Eliakim the son of Hilkiah:
hmr: “Chun, chu nia chun ka siehlaw Eliakim, Hilkia naupa chu, ko ka ta;

en: and I will clothe him with thy robe, and strengthen him with thy girdle, and I will commit thy government into his hand; and he shall be a father to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and to the house of Judah.
hmr: ama chu i zakawfuol hi inhâktir ka tih, i kâwngkhi hin sukhrât ka ta, i rorêlna hi a kutah inkawltir ka tih; chuongchun, ama chu Jerusalema umhai ta dingin le Juda sûnghai ta dingin pa nîng a tih.

en: And the key of the house of David will I lay upon his shoulder; and he shall open, and none shall shut; and he shall shut, and none shall open.
hmr: David sûnghai châbi chu a lieng- koah sieng ka ta, ama chun hawng a ta, tukhawma khâr naw ni hai; khâr a ta tukhawma hawng naw ni hai.

en: And I will fasten him as a nail in a sure place; and he shall be for a throne of glory to his father’s house.
hmr: Ama chu kilna hi hmun dettaka an kil tlat angin, sukdet tlat ka ta, chuongchun, ama chu a pa sûnghai ta dingin lalṭhungpha ropuitak ding nîng a tih.

en: And they shall hang upon him all the glory of his father’s house, the offspring and the issue, every small vessel, from the cups even to all the flagons.
hmr: Amaa chun a pa sûnghai ro- puina po po chu la khai vawng an ta, a nauhai le a thlahai, bûr le bêl chîn tinrêng, berbu bûr le bêla inthawka tui siena bûr le bêl po po chenin.

en: In that day, saith Jehovah of hosts, shall the nail that was fastened in a sure place give way; and it shall be hewn down, and fall; and the burden that was upon it shall be cut off; for Jehovah hath spoken it.
hmr: Chu nia chun, kilna, hmun nghettaka kil tlata um chun la dâwl naw nih; sât thlâka umin, tla tâng a ta, a chunga thil rik um chu sukbo- hmangin um tâng a tih, LALPAIN chu chu a hril ta si, sipaihai LALPA chun a tih,” tiin.

en: The burden of Tyre. Howl, ye ships of Tarshish; for it is laid waste, so that there is no house, no entering in: from the land of Kittim it is revealed to them.
hmr: Tura khaw phurrik chu. Tarsis lawng lienhai, khêk rak rak ro; in hrim hrim um naw khawp le lûtna hrim hrim um naw khawp rauin Tura chu suksietin a um ta hi, chu chu Kupra rama inthawk chun an kuoma suklangin a um a.

en: Be still, ye inhabitants of the coast, thou whom the merchants of Sidon, that pass over the sea, have replenished.
hmr: Thlierkâra umhai, to ṭhiep ro, Zidon khaw sumdâwng tuisuorieta fehai isukmuk chu.

en: And on great waters the seed of the Shihor, the harvest of the Nile, was her revenue; and she was the mart of nations.
hmr: Tuipuia Sihor chi, Nile vadung bu sîk chu, a hlâwkna a ni hlak a, hnam tin sumdâwngna hmun a ni hlak.

en: Be thou ashamed, O Sidon; for the sea hath spoken, the stronghold of the sea, saying, I have not travailed, nor brought forth, neither have I nourished young men, nor brought up virgins.
hmr: Aw Zidon, inzak rawh: tuisuoriet, tuisuoriet kulpui chun, thu a hril ta sih a, “Nauha se kân vawi ngai nawh a, nau ka nei ngai bawk nawh, tlang- vâl hlak ka châwm ngai bawk nawh a, nunghâk khawm ka vailien ngai nawh,” tiin.

en: When the report cometh to Egypt, they shall be sorely pained at the report of Tyre.
hmr: Thuthang chu Aigupta ram a tlung pha chun Tura thuthang chu nasatakin invawi an tih.

en: Pass ye over to Tarshish; wail, ye inhabitants of the coast.
hmr: Tarsisah va kai unla; thlierkâra umhai, khêk rak rak ro.

en: Is this your joyous city, whose antiquity is of ancient days, whose feet carried her afar off to sojourn?
hmr: Hi hi maw in khaw hlim tak, a hlunzie khawṭoṭima mi tah, a kein hlataka um dinga a iṭhuoi hlak chu?

en: Who hath purposed this against Tyre, the bestower of crowns, whose merchants are princes, whose traffickers are the honorable of the earth?
hmr: Lallukhum inkhumtirtu khuo Tura chunga hin tuin am hi hi tlung dingin a ruot a? Chutaka sumdâwng- tuhai chu mi lienhai an na, chutaka sumdâwngtuhai chu hnuoi mi inzaumhai an ni sih a.

en: Jehovah of hosts hath purposed it, to stain the pride of all glory, to bring into contempt all the honorable of the earth.
hmr: Sipaihai LALPA chun ropuina po po chapona chu sukmawi lo ding le, hnuoia mi inzaumhai po po hmusit- uma inumtir dingin a ruot a nih.

en: Pass through thy land as the Nile, O daughter of Tarshish; there is no restraint any more.
hmr: Aw Tarsis naunu, Nile vadung angin i rama chun luong liem rawh; i kâwngkhitna hrim hrim a um ta naw hi.

en: He hath stretched out his hand over the sea, he hath shaken the kingdoms: Jehovah hath given commandment concerning Canaan, to destroy the strongholds thereof.
hmr: Tuisuoriet chungah a kut a phar a, ramhai chu a sukhnîng a, LALPA chun Kanaan ram chungchâng thuah thu a pêk a, a kulbînghai sukse ding- in.

en: And he said, Thou shalt no more rejoice, O thou oppressed virgin daughter of Sidon: arise, pass over to Kittim; even there shalt thou have no rest.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “Aw Zidon nau nunghâk, mi nêksâwr, hlim nâwk ta naw ti nih; tho la, Kittim ramah kai rawh; chutaka khawm chun châwlna hrim hrim hmu chuong naw ti nih,” a ta.

en: Behold, the land of the Chaldeans: this people was not; the Assyrian founded it for them that dwell in the wilderness; they set up their towers; they overthrew the palaces thereof; they made it a ruin.
hmr: En ta, Kaldaihai ram hi, hieng mihai hi an um ta nawh; Assuria mi chun thlalêra ramsahai ta dingin a ruot tah a nih; an in insânghai chu a bâwl a, chutaka lal inhai chu an sukbohmang a, in sieah a siem tah a.

en: Howl, ye ships of Tarshish; for your stronghold is laid waste.
hmr: Tarsis lawng lienhai, khêk rak rak ro, in kulbîng chu suksietin a um ta hi.

en: And it shall come to pass in that day, that Tyre shall be forgotten seventy years, according to the days of one king: after the end of seventy years it shall be unto Tyre as in the song of the harlot.
hmr: Chun, chu nia chun, Tura khuo chu, lal pakhat kum tiem a, kum sâwmsari sûng chu theinghilin um a tih; kum sâwmsari bo hnung chun nawchizawr hlaa an hril angin Tura khaw chunga chun la tlung a tih:

en: Take a harp, go about the city, thou harlot that hast been forgotten; make sweet melody, sing many songs, that thou mayest be remembered.
hmr: “Nang nawchizawr mihai theinghil ta hnung! ṭingṭang la la, tuol fang rawh, ṭingṭang kei la, hla tamtak sak rawh, hrieta i um nâwk theina dingin.”

en: And it shall come to pass after the end of seventy years, that Jehovah will visit Tyre, and she shall return to her hire, and shall play the harlot with all the kingdoms of the world upon the face of the earth.
hmr: Chun, kum sâwmsari bo hnung chun, LALPA chun Tura khuo chu hung sir a ta, chuongchun, ama chu a hlaw hnawtin um nâwk a tih, hnuoi chunga khawvêl ram po poa nawchizawrin um a tih.

en: And her merchandise and her hire shall be holiness to Jehovah: it shall not be treasured nor laid up; for her merchandise shall be for them that dwell before Jehovah, to eat sufficiently, and for durable clothing.
hmr: Chun, a sum themsuok le a hlaw chu LALPA ta dinga thil inthieng nîng a ta, chu chu inkhâwlin amanih, sie khâwlin amanih um naw nih a; a sum themsuok chu LALPA hmaa umhai ta dingin a ni ding a ni sih a; hnienghnâra an fâk ding le, silfên ropuitak an nei theina dingin.

en: Behold, Jehovah maketh the earth empty, and maketh it waste, and turneth it upside down, and scattereth abroad the inhabitants thereof.
hmr: Ngai ta, LALPA chun hnuoi hi sukruokin, a sukram ding a na, a letkhupin, a umhai chu a sukdar ding a nih.

en: And it shall be, as with the people, so with the priest; as with the servant, so with his master; as with the maid, so with her mistress; as with the buyer, so with the seller; as with the creditor, so with the debtor; as with the taker of interest, so with the giver of interest to him.
hmr: Chun, vântlâng chunga a um angin, thiempu chunga khawm um a ta, suokpa chunga a um angin a pu chunga khawm um a tih; suoknu chunga a um angin a pi chungah um a ta; inchawtu chunga a um angin a zawrtu chunga khawm um a tih; inpûktirtu chunga a um angin a pûktu chunga khawm um a tih; a pung hnawta inpûktirtu chunga a um angin a kuoma a pung petu chunga khawm um a tih.

en: The earth shall be utterly emptied, and utterly laid waste; for Jehovah hath spoken this word.
hmr: Hnuoi hi sukruok fai dêr le, suksiet fai dêrin um a tih; chu thu chu LALPAIN a hril ta sih a.

en: The earth mourneth and fadeth away, the world languisheth and fadeth away, the lofty people of the earth do languish.
hmr: Hnuoi hi a ṭapin a ṭuoi a, khawvêl hi a ṭuoiin a châu a, hnuoia mi chunghnunghai chu an châu ie.

en: The earth also is polluted under the inhabitants thereof; because they have transgressed the laws, violated the statutes, broken the everlasting covenant.
hmr: Hnuoi hi a umhai hnuoia chun a pawrche zo tah a; dânhai chu an bawsiet a, thuruot chu an sukdang- lam a, kumkhaw thuthlung chu an bawsiet leiin.

en: Therefore hath the curse devoured the earth, and they that dwell therein are found guilty: therefore the inhabitants of the earth are burned, and few men left.
hmr: Chuleiin, ṭawngsie inphurnain hnuoi a fâk zo a, a umhai chu thiem- naw inchangtirin an um tah; chuleiin, hnuoia umhai chu an kâng hlum a, mi tlâwmte chau an um tah.

en: The new wine mourneth, the vine languisheth, all the merry-hearted do sigh.
hmr: Uoin thar chu a ṭap a, grêphrui chu a châu ie, lungrila hlim po pohai chu an inrûm ie.

en: The mirth of tabrets ceaseth, the noise of them that rejoice endeth, the joy of the harp ceaseth.
hmr: Khuongtêhai hlimna chu a reh a, lâwmtaka umhai ri chu a dei ie, ṭing- ṭang hlim ri chu a re ie.

en: They shall not drink wine with a song; strong drink shall be bitter to them that drink it.
hmr: Hla sak pumin uoin dâwn naw ni hai, zu chu a dâwntuhai ta dingin khatak nîng a tih.

en: The waste city is broken down; every house is shut up, that no man may come in.
hmr: Buoina khawpui chu sukchimin a um tah; tukhawm an lût nawna dingin in tin chu khârin a um tah.

en: There is a crying in the streets because of the wine; all joy is darkened, the mirth of the land is gone.
hmr: Uoin leiin kawtthlêrahai chun ṭap ri a um a, hlimna po po sukthimin a um a, hi ram hlimna hi a bo tah.

en: In the city is left desolation, and the gate is smitten with destruction.
hmr: Khawpuia chun rausanna mâk- sanin a um a, a kul kawtkhâr chu vuok sietin a um tah.

en: For thus shall it be in the midst of the earth among the peoples, as the shaking of an olive-tree, as the gleanings when the vintage is done.
hmr: Hnuoi lailia mi tin lai chun hieng ang hin a la um ding a ni sih a, oliv thing vuok hnunga a ra la um hlak ang le, grêp lo hnunga grêp hmu ṭhel lo ding a la um hlak ang el hin.

en: These shall lift up their voice, they shall shout; for the majesty of Jehovah they cry aloud from the sea.
hmr: Chuonghai chun an râwl in- suong an ta, khêk an tih; LALPA ropuina leiin tuisuorieta inthawkin inringtakin an khêk ie.

en: Wherefore glorify ye Jehovah in the east, even the name of Jehovah, the God of Israel, in the isles of the sea.
hmr: Chu chu lei chun LALPA chu khawsaktieng chun chawimawi ro, LALPA Israelhai Pathien hming ngei chu tuisuoriet thlierkârahai chun chawimawi ro.

en: From the uttermost part of the earth have we heard songs: Glory to the righteous. But I said, I pine away, I pine away, woe is me! the treacherous have dealt treacherously; yea, the treacherous have dealt very treacherously.
hmr: Kâwlkawdawnga hla sakhai kan hriet a, “Mi felhai kuomah ro- puina um raw se,” ti hla hi. Nisien- lakhawm, kei chun, “Ka chêr deu deu a, ka chêr deu deu a, ka chung a rik ie! vervêktaka thawtuhai chun vervêk- takin an thawh a, anih, vervêktaka thawtuhai chun vervêktakin an thaw,” ka tih a.

en: Fear, and the pit, and the snare, are upon thee, O inhabitant of the earth.
hmr: Aw hnuoia um, ṭitumna dâm, khur dâm, châng dâm chu i chungah a um a.

en: And it shall come to pass, that he who fleeth from the noise of the fear shall fall into the pit; and he that cometh up out of the midst of the pit shall be taken in the snare: for the windows on high are opened, and the foundations of the earth tremble.
hmr: Chuongchun, ṭitum ria in- thawka tlânhmang chu khura chun tlâng a ta; khur sûnga inthawka hung suok chu chângah âwk a tih; chung- tienga tukverhai chu hawngin a um sih a; leihnuoi innghatsan chu ân hnîng bawk a nih.

en: The earth is utterly broken, the earth is rent asunder, the earth is shaken violently.
hmr: Hnuoi hi a kawi se vawng a, hnuoi hi sukboin a um tah, hnuoi hi nasatakin ân hnîng a.

en: The earth shall stagger like a drunken man, and shall sway to and fro like a hammock; and the transgression thereof shall be heavy upon it, and it shall fall, and not rise again.
hmr: Hnuoi hi zu inrui ang elin pêm thlawk thlawk a ta, bûktê insâwi angin insâwi dar dar a tih; a baw- sietna chu a chungah riktakin um a ta, chuongchun, tlûng a ta, tho nâwk ta naw nih.

en: And it shall come to pass in that day, that Jehovah will punish the host of the high ones on high, and the kings of the earth upon the earth.
hmr: Chun, chu nia chun LALPA chun chungtienga mi achunghnung- hai pâwl lientak chu hrem a tih, hnuoia hnuoi lalhai leh.

en: And they shall be gathered together, as prisoners are gathered in the pit, and shall be shut up in the prison; and after many days shall they be visited.
hmr: Chun, mi intânghai khursûnga ṭhuoi khâwma an um angin chuong- hai chu ṭhuoi khâwmin um an ta, intângna ina khumin um an ta, ni sâwttak hnunga chun hremin um an tih.

en: Then the moon shall be confounded, and the sun ashamed; for Jehovah of hosts will reign in mount Zion, and in Jerusalem; and before his elders shall be glory.
hmr: Chu hnunga chun thla khi inzaktakin um a ta, nisa khi muol- photakin um a tih; sipaihai LALPA chu Zion tlâng le, Jerusalem khuoa le, a upahai hmaa chun, ropuitakin lalah a um ding a ni sih a.

en: O Jehovah, thou art my God; I will exalt thee, I will praise thy name; for thou hast done wonderful things, even counsels of old, in faithfulness and truth.
hmr: Aw LALPA, nang chu ka Pathien i na; chawimawi ka ti cheh a, i hming inpâk ka tih; thil maktak, inhmaa remruothai chu, ringumtak le thutakin i thaw sih a.

en: For thou hast made of a city a heap, of a fortified city a ruin, a palace of strangers to be no city; it shall never be built.
hmr: Khawpui khawm hnuoi pâwngah în changtir a; khuo kulpui nei khawm khaw ṭawpah în changtir a; ram dang mihai lal in khawm bâwlin um nâwk ta naw nih.

en: Therefore shall a strong people glorify thee; a city of terrible nations shall fear thee.
hmr: Chuleiin, mi hrâttakhai chun chawimawi an ti cheh a, hnam ṭium- tak khawpuihai chun ṭîng an ti che.

en: For thou hast been a stronghold to the poor, a stronghold to the needy in his distress, a refuge from the storm, a shade from the heat, when the blast of the terrible ones is as a storm against the wall.
hmr: Mi ṭiumhai thuok chu thlipuiin bang a nam sawk sawk anga a hung um lai hin, nang chu mi rimsihai ta dingin kulbîng, pasie lunginzîng laia dinga kulbîng, thlipuia inthawka inhumhimna, nisa sat hlietu i ni hlak sih a.

en: As the heat in a dry place wilt thou bring down the noise of strangers; as the heat by the shade of a cloud, the song of the terrible ones shall be brought low.
hmr: Hmun ṭâwla khaw lum chu i sukre hlak ang hin ram dang mihai ri chu sukbo i tih, khaw lum chu sûm hlieha sukboa a um hlak ang hin, mi ṭiumhai hla sak chu sukboin um a tih.

en: And in this mountain will Jehovah of hosts make unto all peoples a feast of fat things, a feast of wines on the lees, of fat things full of marrow, of wines on the lees well refined.
hmr: Chun, hi tlânga hin sipaihai LALPA chun mi tinrênghai ta dingin thil thauhaiin ruoi ṭhêng a tih, uoin- hai a fe le inchie zing, thil thautakhai thlina sip, uoinhai a fe le inchie zing ṭhataka thlit fai chu.

en: And he will destroy in this mountain the face of the covering that covereth all peoples, and the veil that is spread over all nations.
hmr: Chun, mi tinrêng an inkhumna le, hnam tinrêng an inkhumna chu, hi tlânga hin suksieng a tih.

en: He hath swallowed up death for ever; and the Lord Jehovah will wipe away tears from off all faces; and the reproach of his people will he take away from off all the earth: for Jehovah hath spoken it.
hmr: Thina chu a lem sawng tah; Lalpa PATHIEN chun mi po po hmaia inthawk chu mitthlihai chu hrufai a tih; a mihai hming sietna chu leihnuoi po po chunga inthawk hin la hmang a tih; LALPAIN chu chu a hril ta sih a.

en: And it shall be said in that day, Lo, this is our God; we have waited for him, and he will save us: this is Jehovah; we have waited for him, we will be glad and rejoice in his salvation.
hmr: Chun, chu nia chun, “Ngai ta u, hi hi ei Pathien a ni hi, ama hi ei nghâk zing a; chuongchun, ama chun mi sandam a tih: hi hi LALPA chu a ni hi; ama hi ei nghâk zing a, a san- damnaa chun hlimin lâwm ei tih,” tîng an tih.

en: For in this mountain will the hand of Jehovah rest; and Moab shall be trodden down in his place, even as straw is trodden down in the water of the dunghill.
hmr: Hi tlânga hin LALPA kut chu innghat a ta. Moab chu, bupâwl chu êkthlia sirdea a um hlak ang hin, ama hmunah sirdein a um ding a ni sih a.

en: And he shall spread forth his hands in the midst thereof, as he that swimmeth spreadeth forth his hands to swim; but Jehovah will lay low his pride together with the craft of his hands.
hmr: Chuongchun, tui inhlieuin tui inhlieu dinga a vai ang hin, chu lai chun a kut chu vai a tih; chun, a chapona chu a kut vervêk pum chun LALPA chun sie hnuoi a tih.

en: And the high fortress of thy walls hath he brought down, laid low, and brought to the ground, even to the dust.
hmr: Chun, i kul banghai, in insâng kulpui chu sukchimin, sie hnuoiin, hnuoiah, pilvut tlung khawp rakin sukthlûng a tih.

en: In that day shall this song be sung in the land of Judah: We have a strong city; salvation will he appoint for walls and bulwarks.
hmr: Chu nia chun Juda ramah hi hla hi sak an tih; “Khawpui dettak ei nei a, ama chun sandamna chu kul banghai le kulpuihai leh ruot a tih.

en: Open ye the gates, that the righteous nation which keepeth faith may enter in.
hmr: Hnam fel thutak zâwmtu chu a lût theina dingin kul kawtkhârhai chu hawng ro.

en: Thou wilt keep him in perfect peace, whose mind is stayed on thee; because he trusteth in thee.
hmr: I chunga lungril innghattu chu nang a ring che leiin, lungmuongtaka um dingin vêng i tih.

en: Trust ye in Jehovah for ever; for in Jehovah, even Jehovah, is an everlasting rock.
hmr: LALPA chu kumkhuoin ring ro; LALPA JEHOVAA chun kumkhaw lungpui chu a um sih a.

en: For he hath brought down them that dwell on high, the lofty city: he layeth it low, he layeth it low even to the ground; he bringeth it even to the dust.
hmr: Ama chun insângtaka umhai chu a suktlâwm ta sih a, khawpui insângtak chu; chu chu a sie hnuoi a, hnuoi tlung rakin a sie hnuoi a, pilvut tlung rakin a sukthlûk a.

en: The foot shall tread it down; even the feet of the poor, and the steps of the needy.
hmr: Ke chun sirdêng a ta, rimsihai ke le pasiehai kalchawi ngei chun.

en: The way of the just is uprightness: thou that art upright dost direct the path of the just.
hmr: Mi fel lampui chu indikna a na, nang lungril indiktak put chun mi fel lampui chu i sukruol hlak.

en: Yea, in the way of thy judgments, O Jehovah, have we waited for thee; to thy name, even to thy memorial name, is the desire of our soul.
hmr: Anih, Aw LALPA, i rorêlna lam- puia chun kan nghâk zing cheh a, kan hringna dit zâwng chu i hming tieng le i hriet zingna tieng hi a nih.

en: With my soul have I desired thee in the night; yea, with my spirit within me will I seek thee earnestly: for when thy judgments are in the earth, the inhabitants of the world learn righteousness.
hmr: Ka hringna hin zâna chun a ngai cheh a; anih, ka sûnga thlarau um hin zîngkâr chun ka zawng che; i rorêl- nahai chu hnuoiah a um po leh khawvêla umhai chun felna chu an inchûk hlak sih a.

en: Let favor be showed to the wicked, yet will he not learn righteousness; in the land of uprightness will he deal wrongfully, and will not behold the majesty of Jehovah.
hmr: Mi rilo chu ditsakin um sienla khawm, felna inchûk chuong naw nih: indikna rama chun indik naw- takin thâwng a ta, LALPA ropuina hmu chuong naw ni.

en: Jehovah, thy hand is lifted up, yet they see not: but they shall see thy zeal for the people, and be put to shame; yea, fire shall devour thine adversaries.
hmr: “LALPA, i kut chu pharin a um a, nisienlakhawm, an hmu si nawh; amiruokchu, mihai ta dinga i ṭha- hnemngaina chu hmûng an ta, inzak tâng an tih; anih, nangma dotuhai chu meiin kâng hmang a tih.

en: Jehovah, thou wilt ordain peace for us; for thou hast also wrought all our works for us.
hmr: LALPA, nangin inremna mi ruotpêk i ta; nangin kan sin po po khawm i mi thawpêk sih a.

en: O Jehovah our God, other lords besides thee have had dominion over us; but by thee only will we make mention of thy name.
hmr: Aw LALPA kan Pathien, nang chau ni loin, lal dang khawma kan chungah thu an nei ta hlak a, nisien- lakhawm, nangma ṭhangpui ngeiin i hming hi lam tâng kan tih.

en: They are dead, they shall not live; they are deceased, they shall not rise: therefore hast thou visited and destroyed them, and made all remembrance of them to perish.
hmr: Anni chu an thi tah a, hring nâwk ta naw ni hai, an bo tah a, tho nâwk ta naw ni hai; chuleiin, nangin anni chu hremin i suksiet a, an hriet zingna po po khawm i sukbohmang tah.

en: Thou hast increased the nation, O Jehovah, thou hast increased the nation; thou art glorified; thou hast enlarged all the borders of the land.
hmr: Hi hnam hi i sukpung tah a, aw LALPA, hi hnam hi i sukpung tah; nang chu chawimawiin i um tah a, hi ram hi a ramri po po chu i suklien tah.

en: Jehovah, in trouble have they visited thee; they poured out a prayer when thy chastening was upon them.
hmr: “LALPA, an lunginzîng lai chun an sir hlak cheh a, i hremna chu an chunga a tlâk lai chun an ṭawngṭai zawmzawt a.

en: Like as a woman with child, that draweth near the time of her delivery, is in pain and crieth out in her pangs; so we have been before thee, O Jehovah.
hmr: Nuhmei nau vawn, nei hun ta chu, a na hlak a, nauhasea a khêk rawng rawng hlak ang hin, aw LALPA, keini khawm i hmaah kan um hlak kha.

en: We have been with child, we have been in pain, we have as it were brought forth wind; we have not wrought any deliverance in the earth; neither have the inhabitants of the world fallen.
hmr: Nau kan vawn a, kan nah a, thli ang chau el kan nei kha, hnuoia hin sansuokna kawng hrim kan sukkaw nawh a, khawvêla umhai hlak an tlu bawk nawh.

en: Thy dead shall live; my dead bodies shall arise. Awake and sing, ye that dwell in the dust; for thy dew is as the dew of herbs, and the earth shall cast forth the dead.
hmr: I mithihai chu hring nâwk an ta, an ruonghai chu tho nâwk an tih. Pilvuta umhai, har unla, hlimtakin hla sak ro, i daidâw chu thlaihai daidâw ang a na, hnuoi hin mithihai chu a pei suok ding a ni sih a,” ti hi.

en: Come, my people, enter thou into thy chambers, and shut thy doors about thee: hide thyself for a little moment, until the indignation be overpast.
hmr: Hung ta u, ka mihai, in pindan sûngahai lût unla, in kawthai chu inkhâr khum ro, lungninawna hi ân kieng hmakhat chun mitkhapkâr chau bêk inbihmang ro.

en: For, behold, Jehovah cometh forth out of his place to punish the inhabitants of the earth for their iniquity: the earth also shall disclose her blood, and shall no more cover her slain.
hmr: Ngai ta u, LALPA chu, an suolna leia hnuoia umhai hrem dingin a umnaa inthawk chun a hung ṭum ding a nih; hnuoi khawm hin a thisenhai chu suklang a ta, mi an thathai chu inkhum ta naw ni.

en: In that day Jehovah with his hard and great and strong sword will punish leviathan the swift serpent, and leviathan the crooked serpent; and he will slay the monster that is in the sea.
hmr: Chu nia chun LALPA chun a kâwlhnâm ngei ṭhatak, lien- tak, ringumtak chun leviathan rûlpui hrâttak le leviathan rûlpui kâwi ngul chu hrem a ta, tuipuia dragon um chu that bawk a tih.

en: In that day: A vineyard of wine, sing ye unto it.
hmr: Chu nia chun, “Uoin grêp huon pakhat chu, chu chu chawimawiin hla sak ro.

en: I Jehovah am its keeper; I will water it every moment: lest any hurt it, I will keep it night and day.
hmr: Kei LALPA hi a vêngtu ka nih; mitkhapkâr tinin tui buok ka ta, tukhawma an tâwk nawna dingin a sûn a zânin vêng ka tih.

en: Wrath is not in me: would that the briers and thorns were against me in battle! I would march upon them, I would burn them together.
hmr: Keimaa hin lunginsenna a um nawh ie; buor le hlohlingneihai chun mi doin mi hung thaw hrim hai sien aw! anni chu thaw dingin fêng ka ta, hmun khatah ka raw hlut hlut ding bah.

en: Or else let him take hold of my strength, that he may make peace with me; yea, let him make peace with me.
hmr: An naw vêk leh, keima le inremna dingin ka hrâtna hi chel raw se; anih, mîn rempui ro.”

en: In days to come shall Jacob take root; Israel shall blossom and bud; and they shall fill the face of the world with fruit.
hmr: Hun la hung tlung dinga chun Jakobhai chun zung kei an ta; Israelhai chu kumûmin pâr an tih; chuongchun, hnuoi chung hi rain suksip an tih.

en: Hath he smitten them as he smote those that smote them? or are they slain according to the slaughter of them that were slain by them?
hmr: Ama vawtuhai a vuok ang takin ama chu a vuok vêm a nih? annawleh, ama thathai that ang takin ama chu thatin a um vêm a nih?

en: In measure, when thou sendest them away, thou dost contend with them; he hath removed them with his rough blast in the day of the east wind.
hmr: Ama chu în fe hmangtir laiin a hun charin ama chu i sêl a; khawsak thli hrâng ni chun ân thli natak chun ama chu a lên sawn tah a.

en: Therefore by this shall the iniquity of Jacob be forgiven, and this is all the fruit of taking away his sin: that he maketh all the stones of the altar as chalkstones that are beaten in sunder, so that the Asherim and the sun-images shall rise no more.
hmr: Chuleiin, hi hin Jakobhai rîtlona chu sâwpfai nîng a ta, hi hi an suol fe hmangpuina ra ruok a nih; Aserahai le nisa limhai chu tho nâwk ta lo ding khawpin mâichâm lung po po chu tlak lung suknawi rem rum ang elin an siem hi.

en: For the fortified city is solitary, a habitation deserted and forsaken, like the wilderness: there shall the calf feed, and there shall he lie down, and consume the branches thereof.
hmr: Khuo kulpui nei chu a khaw- sâwt a, umna, mi hnungsawn le fesan hnung a ni ta sih a, thlalêr ang elin; chutaka chun bâwngtê tlâng a ta, chutaka bawk chun bawk a ta, a kauhai chu fâng a tih.

en: When the boughs thereof are withered, they shall be broken off; the women shall come, and set them on fire; for it is a people of no understanding: therefore he that made them will not have compassion upon them, and he that formed them will show them no favor.
hmr: A kauhai chu a vuoi pha chun thliekin um a ta, nuhmeihai hung an ta, raw el an tih; hriet theina hrim hrim nei naw mihai an ni sih a; chuleiin, anni siemtu chun anni chu lunginsiet naw nih a, anni inngîrtu chun anni chu a ditin ditsak hrim hrim bawk naw nih.

en: And it shall come to pass in that day, that Jehovah will beat off his fruit from the flood of the River unto the brook of Egypt; and ye shall be gathered one by one, O ye children of Israel.
hmr: Chu nia chun LALPA chun Vadung a kuong sipa luong dûl dûla inthawkin, Aigupta vadungtê chenin a ra vaw thlâng a ta; chuongchun, aw Israel thlahai, a khât khâta rûtin um in tih.

en: And it shall come to pass in that day, that a great trumpet shall be blown; and they shall come that were ready to perish in the land of Assyria, and they that were outcasts in the land of Egypt; and they shall worship Jehovah in the holy mountain at Jerusalem.
hmr: Chu nia chun tawtawrâwt lientak mût an ta; chuongchun, Assuria rama bohmang vâng vânghai le, Aigupta rama hnawtdawka umhai chu hung an ta; Jerusalem khuoa tlâng inthienga chun, LALPA chu chibai bûk an tih.

en: Woe to the crown of pride of the drunkards of Ephraim, and to the fading flower of his glorious beauty, which is on the head of the fat valley of them that are overcome with wine!
hmr: Ephraimhai zu inruihmanghai chapona lallukhum chung le, an mawina ropui pâr ṭuoi mêk, uoin inchie hnea umhai ruom ṭhatakin a khum chung chu a rik ie!

en: Behold, the Lord hath a mighty and strong one; as a tempest of hail, a destroying storm, as a tempest of mighty waters overflowing, will he cast down to the earth with the hand.
hmr: Ngai ta, LALPA chun mi hrât thilthawtheitak a nei a; ama chun riel nasatak tla dur dur, thlipui thil sukse rem rum ang le, tuilien nasatak lien zur zur ang elin, hnuoiah pei chawr a tih.

en: The crown of pride of the drunkards of Ephraim shall be trodden under foot:
hmr: Ephraimhai zu inruihmang chapona lallukhum chu sirdein um a ta;

en: and the fading flower of his glorious beauty, which is on the head of the fat valley, shall be as the first-ripe fig before the summer; which when he that looketh upon it seeth, while it is yet in his hand he eateth it up.
hmr: an mawina ropui pâr ṭuoi mêk, ruom ṭhatakin a khum chu, nipui hmaa theichang hmin hmasa tak, a entuin a hmuh a, a kuta a um phinga a fâk zo el hlak ang chu nîng a tih.

en: In that day will Jehovah of hosts become a crown of glory, and a diadem of beauty, unto the residue of his people;
hmr: Chu nia chun sipaihai LALPA chu, a mi la um sunhai ta dingin ropuina lallukhum dâm, mawina lukhum dâm,

en: and a spirit of justice to him that sitteth in judgment, and strength to them that turn back the battle at the gate.
hmr: rorêl dinga ṭhung ta dinga rorêlna thlarau dâm, kul kawtkhâr bula hung thawtuhai dangkîrtuhai ta dinga hrâtna nîng a tih.

en: And even these reel with wine, and stagger with strong drink; the priest and the prophet reel with strong drink, they are swallowed up of wine, they stagger with strong drink; they err in vision, they stumble in judgment.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, chuonghai khawm chu uoin leiin an thle an thle a, zu leiin an pêm an pêm a, thiempuhai le zâwlneihai chu zu leiin an thle a, uoin lem zoin an um a, zu leiin an pêm an pêm a; inlârna thuah an thle an thle hlak a, rorêlna thuah an pêm an pêm hlak.

en: For all tables are full of vomit and filthiness, so that there is no place clean.
hmr: Hmun fai hrim hrim um naw khawpin dawkân po po chu luok le thil pawrchein a sip a nih.

en: Whom will he teach knowledge? and whom will he make to understand the message? them that are weaned from the milk, and drawn from the breasts?
hmr: Hrietna tieng chu tu hîm ân chûktir ding a ni leh? Thucha chu tu hîm ân hriettir ding a ni leh? Nene nêk bân chauhai le nêne innêktir ta lohai hîm an ni ding?

en: For it is precept upon precept, precept upon precept; line upon line, line upon line; here a little, there a little.
hmr: Thununna thu chunga thu- nunna thu inchuon a, thununna thu chunga thununna thu inchuon a, dân chunga dân inchuon a, dân chunga dân inchuon a; hitakah tlâwmte, sawtakah tlâwmte, ti ruok a ni sih a.

en: Nay, but by men of strange lips and with another tongue will he speak to this people;
hmr: Anih, nisienlakhawm, hmûr danglam put mi hmangin, ṭawng dangin hieng mihai kuoma hin thu hril lem tâng a tih:

en: to whom he said, This is the rest, give ye rest to him that is weary; and this is the refreshing: yet they would not hear.
hmr: “Hi hi a nih châwlna chu, sâwl- hai chu inchâwltir ro; hi hi a nih insukharna chu,” a tihai chu: nisien- lakhawm, an ngai nuom si nawh.

en: Therefore shall the word of Jehovah be unto them precept upon precept, precept upon precept; line upon line, line upon line; here a little, there a little; that they may go, and fall backward, and be broken, and snared, and taken.
hmr: Chuleiin, an feh a, an thala an tlûk a, an kawinawi a, chânga an âwk a, mana an um theina dingin, LALPA thu chu annirawi ta ding chun, thu- nunna thu chunga thununna inchuon a, thununna thu chunga thununna inchuon a, dân chunga dân inchuon a, dân chunga dân inchuon a; sawtakah tlawmte, hitakah tlâwmte ti ruok ni el a tih.

en: Wherefore hear the word of Jehovah, ye scoffers, that rule this people that is in Jerusalem:
hmr: Chuleichun, mi hmusit hmang- hai, hieng mihai, Jerusalema umhai ro rêlpêktuhai, LALPA thu hi hre ro.

en: Because ye have said, We have made a covenant with death, and with Sheol are we at agreement; when the overflowing scourge shall pass through, it shall not come unto us; for we have made lies our refuge, and under falsehood have we hid ourselves:
hmr: “Thina kuomah thu kan thlung tah, Seol leh thu kan intiem tah; vuokna tui lien liem chu a luong tlang pha khawm keini chen chun luong naw nih; khêl thu dâm kan inhumhim- na dingin kan hmang a, khêl hnuoi- ah kan inbihmang ta sih a,” in ti leiin;

en: therefore thus saith the Lord Jehovah, Behold, I lay in Zion for a foundation a stone, a tried stone, a precious corner-stone of sure foundation: he that believeth shall not be in haste.
hmr: chuleiin, Lalpa Pathien chun hieng ang hin a hril, “Ngai ta, lung, lung fie hnung, a kia lung hlutak ka phûm, dettak chu, Ziona chun lung- phûm dingin ka rem hi; ama ringtu chu inhmaw naw nih.

en: And I will make justice the line, and righteousness the plummet; and the hail shall sweep away the refuge of lies, and the waters shall overflow the hiding-place.
hmr: Rorêlna fel chu a suktlûnna hruiin hmang ka ta, felna chu a dârmûmkhaiah hmang ka tih, riel chun inhumhimna khêl thuhai chu dêng hmang vawng a ta, tuihai chun inbîkhmangna chu chîm tlum a tih.

en: And your covenant with death shall be annulled, and your agreement with Sheol shall not stand; when the overflowing scourge shall pass through, then ye shall be trodden down by it.
hmr: Chun, thina kuoma in thu- thlung chu sûtin um a ta, Seol le in thutiem khawm chu ngir suok naw ni, vuokna tui lien liem chu a luong tlang pha chun, chu pha chun sirdein um in tih.

en: As often as it passeth through, it shall take you; for morning by morning shall it pass through, by day and by night: and it shall be nought but terror to understand the message.
hmr: A luong tlang po leh la pei a ti cheu a; tûk tin tûk tinin, a sûn a zânin, a luong tlang âwm sih a; thu incha umze hriet chu thil râpthlâk ruok nîng a tih,” tiin.

en: For the bed is shorter than that a man can stretch himself on it; and the covering narrower than that he can wrap himself in it.
hmr: Khum chu inthluongna dingin a tawi ta law sih a; puonthuo chu inkhumna dingin a chîn talaw bawk si.

en: For Jehovah will rise up as in mount Perazim, he will be wroth as in the valley of Gibeon; that he may do his work, his strange work, and bring to pass his act, his strange act.
hmr: A sin, a sin danglam chu, a thaw theina ding le, a thilthaw, a thilthaw danglam chu a muolsuo theina dingin, LALPA chu Perazim tlânga a tho ang khan a tho ding a ni sih a, Gibeon ruoma a lunginsen ang khan a lunginsen ding a ni sih a.

en: Now therefore be ye not scoffers, lest your bonds be made strong; for a decree of destruction have I heard from the Lord, Jehovah of hosts, upon the whole earth.
hmr: Chuongchun, mi hmusit hmang- tuhai ni ta naw ro, chuong naw chun, in kawl bunhai chu ringumtakin siem rawi an tih; tâwpna, tâwpna tlung ngei dinga ruot tlat chu, hnuoi pum- pui chunga a tlung ding thu, Lalpa, sipaihai LALPA kuoma inthawk chun ka hriet sih a.

en: Give ye ear, and hear my voice; hearken, and hear my speech.
hmr: Na sit unla, ka râwl hi hre ro, ngai unla, ka thu hril hi hre ro.

en: Doth he that ploweth to sow plow continually? doth he continually open and harrow his ground?
hmr: Hnuoi inlettu chun chi thena dingin hnuoi chu ân let ân let el hlak am a nih? a hnuoi tlanghai chu a suknawiin a sukphit zing hlak am a nih?

en: When he hath levelled the face thereof, doth he not cast abroad the fitches, and scatter the cummin, and put in the wheat in rows, and the barley in the appointed place, and the spelt in the border thereof?
hmr: A chung chu a chawkruol zoin Mohuri chu a thedar ni lo am a nih? Zira dâm khawm a the ni lo am a nih? Bu dâm chu a tlarin, buṭei  dâm chu hmun ruotah, mimhai khawm chu a hnâwm hrûlah a tû hlak ni lo am a nih?

en: For his God doth instruct him aright, and doth teach him.
hmr: A Pathien chun ama chu feltak- in a thununin ân chûktir hlak sih a.

en: For the fitches are not threshed with a sharp threshing instrument, neither is a cart wheel turned about upon the cummin; but the fitches are beaten out with a staff, and the cummin with a rod.
hmr: Mohuri chu bu chîlna khâwl ngeiin an chil ngai si nawh a, zira chungahai chun tawlailîr kehai chu an inhlumtir ngai bawk nawh; mohu- ri chu hmawlin an vuok lem hlak.

en: Bread grain is ground; for he will not be always threshing it: and though the wheel of his cart and his horses scatter it, he doth not grind it.
hmr: Beiphit bu chu râwtnawiin a um hlak, kumkhuoin a vuok zing âwm si nawh a, tawlailîr ke le a sakawr chun sukdar sienla khawm, ân râwt- nawitir ngai nawh.

en: This also cometh forth from Jehovah of hosts, who is wonderful in counsel, and excellent in wisdom.
hmr: Chuong khawm chu sipaihai LALPA, inrâwnna kawnga mi mak- tak le, varna kawnga mi ṭhatak kuoma chu a suok a nih.

en: Ho Ariel, Ariel, the city where David encamped! add ye year to year; let the feasts come round:
hmr: E Ariel, Ariel, David umhmun khuorna khuo! kumah kum bel ro; ruoiṭhe hunhai chu hung tlung nâwk raw se;

en: then will I distress Ariel, and there shall be mourning and lamentation; and she shall be unto me as Ariel.
hmr: chu pha chun Ariel hi suklung- zîng ka ta; chuongchun, sûnna le ṭapna um a tih; chun, ama chu ka ta dingin Ariel ang chu nîng a tih.

en: And I will encamp against thee round about, and will lay siege against thee with posted troops, and I will raise siege works against thee.
hmr: Chun, nang chu thaw tumin i vêla chun ep ka ti cheh a, kul siemin inhuol vêl bawk ka ti cheh a, thaw ding chein inhuol vêlna kulbînghai siem bawk ka tih.

en: And thou shalt be brought down, and shalt speak out of the ground, and thy speech shall be low out of the dust; and thy voice shall be as of one that hath a familiar spirit, out of the ground, and thy speech shall whisper out of the dust.
hmr: Chuongchun, sukthlûkin um i ta, hnuoi hnuoia inthawkin thu hril i ta; i ṭawng chu pilvut lai chun damtein inri suok a tih: i râwl chu khawhri aisânthiem râwl ri ang chauin hnuoi hnuoia inthawk chun hung suok a tih; i ṭawng chu pilvut laia inthawk chun hung suok sê sêng a tih.

en: But the multitude of thy foes shall be like small dust, and the multitude of the terrible ones as chaff that passeth away: yea, it shall be in an instant suddenly.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, nanga dotu mipuihai chu pilvut inditak angin um an ta, mi ṭiumhai mipuihai chu busi bohmang hlak ang hin um bawk an tih; anih, chu chu mitkhapkâr loin um thut a tih.

en: She shall be visited of Jehovah of hosts with thunder, and with earthquake, and great noise, with whirlwind and tempest, and the flame of a devouring fire.
hmr: Vâninrûm dâm, simkhawleihnuoi inhnîng dâm, ri nasatak dâm, thlivir dâm, thlipui dâm, thil kâng hmang thei meichawk dâmin ama chu sipaihai LALPA hremin um a tih.

en: And the multitude of all the nations that fight against Ariel, even all that fight against her and her stronghold, and that distress her, shall be as a dream, a vision of the night.
hmr: Chuongchun, Ariel dotu hnam po po mipuihai, ama le a kulbîng thaw- tuhai po po leh ama suklungzîng- tuhai po po chu mang ang chau nîng an ta, zâna inlâr ang chau el hi.

en: And it shall be as when a hungry man dreameth, and, behold, he eateth; but he awaketh, and his soul is empty: or as when a thirsty man dreameth, and, behold, he drinketh; but he awaketh, and, behold, he is faint, and his soul hath appetite: so shall the multitude of all the nations be, that fight against mount Zion.
hmr: Mi phîngṭâmin mang a nei chun bu a lo fâk hlak a; nisienlakhawm, a hang har a, a phîng chu a lo la ruok zing ang hi nîng a tih; annawleh, mi dangchârin mang a nei chun tui a lo dâwn hlak a, nisienlakhawm, a hung har a, a lo la châu zingin, tui a la du rawp ang hi nîng a tih; Zion tlâng thawtu hnam po po mipuihai chu, chuong ang chu an ni ding a nih.

en: Tarry ye and wonder; take your pleasure and be blind: they are drunken, but not with wine; they stagger, but not with strong drink.
hmr: Ngîr zing unla, makti ro, nuom- tâwl unla, mitdelin um ro; an inrui a, nisienlakhawm, uoin lei a ni nawh; an pêm an pêm a, nisienlakhawm, zu lei a ni nawh.

en: For Jehovah hath poured out upon you the spirit of deep sleep, and hath closed your eyes, the prophets; and your heads, the seers, hath he covered.
hmr: LALPA chun îmu hêna thlarau chu in chungah a buok a, in mit, zâwlneihai chu, ân sîmtir a; in lu, hmutheituhai chu, ân khum ta sih a.

en: And all vision is become unto you as the words of a book that is sealed, which men deliver to one that is learned, saying, Read this, I pray thee; and he saith, I cannot, for it is sealed:
hmr: Chuongchun, inlârna hrim hrim in ta dingin lekhabu châr tlata thu ang a ni tah a, chu chu mihaiin lekha thiem mi kuomah, “Lunginsiettakin hi hi tiem rawh,” tiin an pêk hlak a; chun, ama chun, “Ka tiem thei nawh, châr tlat a ni hi,” a ti hlak;

en: and the book is delivered to him that is not learned, saying, Read this, I pray thee; and he saith, I am not learned.
hmr: chun, lekhabu chu lekha thiem naw mi kuomah, “Lunginsiettakin hi hi tiem rawh,” tiin a pêk hlak a; chun, ama chun, “Lekha ka thiem nawh,” a ti hlak.

en: And the Lord said, Forasmuch as this people draw nigh unto me, and with their mouth and with their lips do honor me, but have removed their heart far from me, and their fear of me is a commandment of men which hath been taught them;
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun, “Hieng mihai hin an mi hung hnai a, an bau le an hmûr hin an mi chawimawi hlak deha chu, an lungril chu keia hlatah an sawn hlak a, an mi ṭina chu mihriemhai thupêk miin an inchûktir el chu a nih;

en: therefore, behold, I will proceed to do a marvellous work among this people, even a marvellous work and a wonder; and the wisdom of their wise men shall perish, and the understanding of their prudent men shall be hid.
hmr: chuleiin, ngai ta, hienghai lai hin thilmak thaw nâwk nghâl ka ta, thilmak, thilmaktak el chu; chuong- chun, an mi varhai varna chu bohmang tâng a tih, an mi bengvârhai hrietna chu thupin um tâng a tih,” a ta.

en: Woe unto them that hide deep their counsel from Jehovah, and whose works are in the dark, and that say, Who seeth us? and who knoweth us?
hmr: An remruot chu LALPA kuoma thup dinga inthûktaka zawngtuhai chu an chung a rik ie! an thilthawhai chu inthim hnuoiah a um a, “Tuin am mi hmûng a ta? Tuin am hriet khawm mi hrieng a ta?” an ta.

en: Ye turn things upside down! Shall the potter be esteemed as clay; that the thing made should say of him that made it, He made me not; or the thing formed say of him that formed it, He hath no understanding?
hmr: Thilhai hi in suklinglet vawng hlak de aw! Bêlhemtu chu bepil ang chaua ngaiin a um ding am a nih? Thilsiem chun a siemtu chu, “Ama mi siem ka ni hlak lêm” a ti el chu? annawleh, thil inngîra um chun ân ngîrtu chu, “Hrietna hrim a nei nawh,” ti am a ni leh?

en: Is it not yet a very little while, and Lebanon shall be turned into a fruitful field, and the fruitful field shall be esteemed as a forest?
hmr: Sâwt nawte hnungah ni lo am a ni, Lebanon chu hnuoi ṭhatak hmuna inchangtira uma, hnuoi ṭhatak hmun chu ramhnuoia ngaia a um ding chu?

en: And in that day shall the deaf hear the words of the book, and the eyes of the blind shall see out of obscurity and out of darkness.
hmr: Chu nia chun nasêthai chun lekhabu thu chu nain hre tâng an ta, mitdelhai mithai chun inthim hnuoi le inthim laia inthawkin hmu tâng an tih.

en: The meek also shall increase their joy in Jehovah, and the poor among men shall rejoice in the Holy One of Israel.
hmr: Thuhnuoirawlhai khawmin LALPAA chun an hlimna chu sukpung tâng an ta, mihriem laia rimsihai chu Israelhai Mi Inthienga chun lâwm tâng an tih.

en: For the terrible one is brought to nought, and the scoffer ceaseth, and all they that watch for iniquity are cut off;
hmr: Mi ṭium chu iengkhawm ni loa siemin um tâng a ta, hmusittu chu a bo tah a, khawhlona nghâkhlatuhai po po chu sukbohmangin an um ta sih a,

en: that make a man an offender in his cause, and lay a snare for him that reproveth in the gate, and turn aside the just with a thing of nought.
hmr: chuonghai chun mi chu thupawi thuah suksuoltuah an siem hlak a, kul kawtkhârah kâwktu âwkna ding- in châng an kam hlak a, mi fel chu thil teplo mei meiin an inkhêltir hlak.

en: Therefore thus saith Jehovah, who redeemed Abraham, concerning the house of Jacob: Jacob shall not now be ashamed, neither shall his face now wax pale.
hmr: Chuleiin, LALPA, Abraham in- tlantu chun, Jakob sûnghai chung- châng thuah hieng ang hin a tih, “Jakobhai chu tuhin chu muolpho ta naw ni hai a, an hmai chu dâng ta bawk naw ni.

en: But when he seeth his children, the work of my hands, in the midst of him, they shall sanctify my name; yea, they shall sanctify the Holy One of Jacob, and shall stand in awe of the God of Israel.
hmr: An nau, ka kutsuokhai chu, anni laia an hmu chun, ka hming chu sukthieng lem tâng an tih; anih, Jakobhai Mi Inthieng chu sukthieng an ta, Israelhai Pathien chu ṭi tâng an tih.

en: They also that err in spirit shall come to understanding, and they that murmur shall receive instruction.
hmr: Thlaraua invâkhmanghai khawm chun hrethiem tâng an ta, mi chierhai chun thuinchûktir chu in- chûktir tâng an tih,” tiin.

en: For, behold, the Lord, Jehovah of hosts, doth take away from Jerusalem and from Judah stay and staff, the whole stay of bread, and the whole stay of water;
hmr: Ngai ta u, LALPA, Sipaihai LALPA chun, Jerusalem kuoma inthawk le, Judahai kuoma inthawk chun an ringpui le an ring tak, an ringpui bu po po le an ring tak tui po po chu, a lâkpêk mêk a ni hi;

en: the mighty man, and the man of war; the judge, and the prophet, and the diviner, and the elder;
hmr: mi hrât le indo thiem, rorêltu le zâwlnei, aisânthiem le upahai leh;

en: the captain of fifty, and the honorable man, and the counsellor, and the expert artificer, and the skilful enchanter.
hmr: sâwmnga hotu le mi inzâum, remruottu le themthiem le ailâk- thiem leh.

en: And I will give children to be their princes, and babes shall rule over them.
hmr: Chuongchun, an mi lienhaia um dingin naupanghai pêng ka ta, nautêhaiin an chungah ro rêl an tih.

en: And the people shall be oppressed, every one by another, and every one by his neighbor: the child shall behave himself proudly against the old man, and the base against the honorable.
hmr: Chun, mihai chu innêksâwrtuoin um an ta, mi tin an ruolhai leh, mi tin mâni tuolbâwmhai leh, naupang chu upa chungah chapotakin um an ta, mi setak khawm mi inzaumtak chungah chapotakin um bawk an tih.

en: When a man shall take hold of his brother in the house of his father, saying, Thou hast clothing, be thou our ruler, and let this ruin be under thy hand;
hmr: Miin a unau a pa ina chelin, “Nang chun silfên i nei a, kan rorêl- tuah um la, hi sietna hi i kutah um raw se,” a ti pha chun;

en: in that day shall he lift up his voice, saying, I will not be a healer; for in my house is neither bread nor clothing: ye shall not make me ruler of the people.
hmr: chu pha chun ama chun a rawl insuong a ta, “Kei chu siemṭhatuah um naw ningah; ka inah fâk ding a um si nawh a, silfên a um bawk nawh a, mihai rorêltuah mi siem naw ti niu,” tiin.

en: For Jerusalem is ruined, and Judah is fallen; because their tongue and their doings are against Jehovah, to provoke the eyes of his glory.
hmr: A ropuina mit chu suknuor dinga an ṭawng le an thilthawhai chu LALPA do tieng a ni leiin Jerusalem chu a se zo a, Judahai chu an tlu zo tah a nih.

en: The show of their countenance doth witness against them; and they declare their sin as Sodom, they hide it not. Woe unto their soul! for they have done evil unto themselves.
hmr: An hmêl put dân hrim chun anni chu a hêk fâwm a; an suolna chu Sodom ang elin an inlangtir a, an ip nawh. An hringna chung chu a rik de! thil ṭha nawin an inthung fâwm pei sih a.

en: Say ye of the righteous, that it shall be well with him; for they shall eat the fruit of their doings.
hmr: Mi fel thua chun, “An la ṭha ding a nih,” ti ro; an thilthaw rahai chu an fâk ding a ni sih a.

en: Woe unto the wicked! it shall be ill with him; for what his hands have done shall be done unto him.
hmr: Mi suol chung chu a rik de! An la se ding a nih; an kuta thilthaw thung- na chu an kuoma pêk a la ni ding a ni sih a.

en: As for my people, children are their oppressors, and women rule over them. O my people, they that lead thee cause thee to err, and destroy the way of thy paths.
hmr: Ka mihai chu anni nêksâwr- tuhai hi naupang an ni tah a, nuhmeihaiin an chungah ro an rêl a. Aw ka mihai, in ṭhuoituhai chun an ṭhuoi suol cheu a, in fena lampuihai chu an suksiet hlak.

en: Jehovah standeth up to contend, and standeth to judge the peoples.
hmr: LALPA chu hrilpui dingin a hung ngîr suok a, mihai ro rêl dingin a hung ngîr tah a.

en: Jehovah will enter into judgment with the elders of his people, and the princes thereof: It is ye that have eaten up the vineyard; the spoil of the poor is in your houses:
hmr: LALPA chun a mihai upahai chunga le, an mi lienhai chunga chun ro rêl a tih. LALPA Sipaihai LALPA chun, “Nangni rawi hi in nih, grêp huon fa zotuhai chu;

en: what mean ye that ye crush my people, and grind the face of the poor? saith the Lord, Jehovah of hosts.
hmr: mi rimsihai kuoma inthawka sum lâk chu in inah a nih a um chu; iengtiziea ka mihai chu in namsâwr a, rimsihai hmai chu in râwtnawi am a ni leh?” a ta.

en: Moreover Jehovah said, Because the daughters of Zion are haughty, and walk with outstretched necks and wanton eyes, walking and mincing as they go, and making a tinkling with their feet;
hmr: Chu naw khawm chu LALPA chun, “Zion naunuhai chu chapotaka an um a, dâk âwr le mi mel kara an lâwn a, an lâwn chu ieng le angin an lâwn a, an kehai an tet ri sawr sawr leiin;

en: therefore the Lord will smite with a scab the crown of the head of the daughters of Zion, and Jehovah will lay bare their secret parts.
hmr: LALPA chun Zion naunuhai lusîpa chun pânna khir inumtir a ta; LALPA chun an zamawhai khawm suklang a tih,” a ta.

en: In that day the Lord will take away the beauty of their anklets, and the cauls, and the crescents;
hmr: Chu ni chun LALPAIN an in- cheimawinahai chu lâkpêk a ta, ke bun dâm, lên lukhum dâm, rîngkawl- hai dâm;

en: the pendants, and the bracelets, and the mufflers;
hmr: nabe inkhai nieng nieng dâm, bânbun dâm, inkhumna puonhai chu;

en: the headtires, and the ankle chains, and the sashes, and the perfume-boxes, and the amulets;
hmr: lucheina dâm, kebun khaidiet dâm, kâwngkhi dâm, riminhnik bâwm dâm, inkhitna dâm chu;

en: the rings, and the nose-jewels;
hmr: hming namna kutsebi dâm, hnâra inbûkhai chu;

en: the festival robes, and the mantles, and the shawls, and the satchels;
hmr: ruoiṭhe ni thuomhnaw dâm, zakawfuol dâm, puon sillai dâm, mansa dâm chu;

en: the hand-mirrors, and the fine linen, and the turbans, and the veils.
hmr: hlimen dâm, puon zai inhmi dâm, lukâwm dâm, intuommawina puon dâm chu.

en: And it shall come to pass, that instead of sweet spices there shall be rottenness; and instead of a girdle, a rope; and instead of well set hair, baldness; and instead of a robe, a girding of sackcloth; branding instead of beauty.
hmr: Chun, mawsawla rim inhniktak aiah thil hmawn um a tih; kâwnghrên aia chun hruihruol um bawk a tih; sam inkir bap aiah lukawlna um a ta; puon mawitak aiah saiip puon dierkei um a tih; hmêl ṭhat aiah thîr linga depsietna um a tih.

en: Thy men shall fall by the sword, and thy mighty in the war.
hmr: I mihai chu kâwlhnâma suk- thlûkin um an ta, i mi hrâttakhai chu indonaah tlûng an tih.

en: And her gates shall lament and mourn; and she shall be desolate and sit upon the ground.
hmr: A kul kawtkhârhai chun an âwm inchumin ṭap an ta; ama chu ruok a ta, hnuoiah inṭhung a tih.

en: Woe to the rebellious children, saith Jehovah, that take counsel, but not of me; and that make a league, but not of my Spirit, that they may add sin to sin,
hmr: LALPA chun, “Nau helhmang- hai chu an chung a rik ie! chuonghai chun mi an râwn a, kei ruok chu an mi râwn si nawh a, an suol chunga suol an belsana dingin inkhumnain an inkhum a, ka thlarau thu ruok chun an inkhum si nawh a;

en: that set out to go down into Egypt, and have not asked at my mouth; to strengthen themselves in the strength of Pharaoh, and to take refuge in the shadow of Egypt!
hmr: Pharao hrâtnaa insukhrât ding le, Aigupta hlim ring dingin, ka bau indawn si loin Aigupta rama fe thlâk tumin an feh a.

en: Therefore shall the strength of Pharaoh be your shame, and the refuge in the shadow of Egypt your confusion.
hmr: Chuleiin, Pharao hrâtna chu in muolphona ni tâng a ta, Aigupta hlim in lo ring hi in inzakna ni tâng a tih.

en: For their princes are at Zoan, and their ambassadors are come to Hanes.
hmr: A mi lienhai chu Zoan khuoah an um a, a palaihai chun Hanes khuo an tlung ta sih a.

en: They shall all be ashamed because of a people that cannot profit them, that are not a help nor profit, but a shame, and also a reproach.
hmr: An ta dinga ṭhathnemna hrim nei lo mi, ṭhangpuitu ni loa, ṭhat- hnemna nei mi ni dêr loa, inzakna le hmingsietna ni lemhai chu, an rêngin lân zâpui an tih,” a ta.

en: The burden of the beasts of the South. Through the land of trouble and anguish, from whence come the lioness and the lion, the viper and fiery flying serpent, they carry their riches upon the shoulders of young asses, and their treasures upon the humps of camels, to a people that shall not profit them.
hmr: Sim rama sahai phurrik chu. Lunginzîngna le thlaphângna ram, sakeibakneipui le sakeibakneichal, rûlhmuk le rûl chawk vuong thei suokna ram chu, an sum chu sabengtungte chunga dâm, an rohai chu sanghâwngsei zângpâwngahai chun phurin an ta dinga ṭhathnemna nei naw mihai kuoma pêk dingin, an fe tlâng duol duol a.

en: For Egypt helpeth in vain, and to no purpose: therefore have I called her Rahab that sitteth still.
hmr: Aigupta chun ṭhahnem lotak le, ṭhangkai lotakin a ṭhangpui hlak sih a; chuleiin a nih, ama chu, “Rahab ṭhung ṭawk ṭawknu” kân bûk chu.

en: Now go, write it before them on a tablet, and inscribe it in a book, that it may be for the time to come for ever and ever.
hmr: Tuhin fe la, chuong chu an hmaa lekhaziekna phêkah ziek la, lekha- bua khawm ziek rawh, hi hnunga kumkhawtluonga ding a ni theina dingin.

en: For it is a rebellious people, lying children, children that will not hear the law of Jehovah;
hmr: Chuonghai chu mi hel hmang dâm, nau khêlhlip dâm, nau, LALPA dân ngai nuom lohai an ni sih a;

en: that say to the seers, See not; and to the prophets, Prophesy not unto us right things, speak unto us smooth things, prophesy deceits,
hmr: hmutheituhai kuomah, “Hmu naw ro,” zâwlneihai kuomah, “Thil indikhai mi hrillâwk ro, thil inhawi tieng kan kuomah hril ro, hlêmna thu hrillâwk naw ro;

en: get you out of the way, turn aside out of the path, cause the Holy One of Israel to cease from before us.
hmr: lampui boah fe ro, lampui sîrah pêt ro; Israelhai Mi Inthieng chu kan hmaa inthawk hin sukbo ro,” ti hlaktuhai chu.

en: Wherefore thus saith the Holy One of Israel, Because ye despise this word, and trust in oppression and perverseness, and rely thereon;
hmr: Chu lei chun, Israelhai Mi Inthieng chun hieng ang hin a hril a, “Hi hi thu hi in hmusit lei le nêksâwrna le kâwmawsietna in ring a, a chunga in innghat leiin;

en: therefore this iniquity shall be to you as a breach ready to fall, swelling out in a high wall, whose breaking cometh suddenly in an instant.
hmr: hi khawhlona hi nangni ta ding chun lung bang insângtak a se lai, chim vâng vâng, pâwng pûr, kârloa, mitkhapkârloa se rup ding ang hi a ni ding a nih.

en: And he shall break it as a potter’s vessel is broken, breaking it in pieces without sparing; so that there shall not be found among the pieces thereof a sherd wherewith to take fire from the hearth, or to dip up water out of the cistern.
hmr: Chuongchun, bêlhemtu bêl chu an suknawi ang hin, hla um dêr loa kawinawiin, a hlek laia, behâr thuka mei lâkna ding amanih, tuikhura tui thâlna ding amani khawm um lo khawpin, sukkawi nawi a tih,” tiin.

en: For thus said the Lord Jehovah, the Holy One of Israel, In returning and rest shall ye be saved; in quietness and in confidence shall be your strength. And ye would not:
hmr: Lalpa PATHIEN, Israelhai Mi Inthieng chun hieng ang hin a hril ta sih a, “Kîr nâwka châwla umin san- damin um in ta; muongtaka umnaa le ringtaka umnaa hin in hrâtna um a tih,” tiin, nisienlakhawm, in nuom si nawh.

en: but ye said, No, for we will flee upon horses; therefore shall ye flee: and, We will ride upon the swift; therefore shall they that pursue you be swift.
hmr: “Ni lo, sakawr chunga chuongin tlân dur dur kan tih,” in ti lem sih a; chuleiin, tlân dur dur ngei in tih; “Thil hrâttak chungah chuong kan tih” in tih a; chuleiin, a hnawttu dinghai cheu chu hrâttak nîng an tih.

en: One thousand shall flee at the threat of one; at the threat of five shall ye flee: till ye be left as a beacon upon the top of a mountain, and as an ensign on a hill.
hmr: Mi pakhat ihrâwkin tlân dur dur in tih; a tâwpa chun tlâng sîpa pholêng târ ang le, muol chunga inchikna mâksana um angin la um el in tih.

en: And therefore will Jehovah wait, that he may be gracious unto you; and therefore will he be exalted, that he may have mercy upon you: for Jehovah is a God of justice; blessed are all they that wait for him.
hmr: Chuleiin, LALPA chun a lungin- siet theina ding cheuin, nghâk a ta, chuleiin, a lainat theina ding cheuin chawimawiin um a tih; LALPA chu rorêl felna Pathien a ni sih a; ama nghâktuhai po po chu an hamṭha ie.

en: For the people shall dwell in Zion at Jerusalem; thou shalt weep no more; he will surely be gracious unto thee at the voice of thy cry; when he shall hear, he will answer thee.
hmr: Mihai chu Jerusalema Ziona chun an um ding a ni sih a; ṭap nâwk ta naw ti niu a, in khêk ria chun ama chun lunginsiet ngei ngei a ti cheu a, a hriet phingleh dawn a ti cheu.

en: And though the Lord give you the bread of adversity and the water of affliction, yet shall not thy teachers be hidden anymore, but thine eyes shall see thy teachers;
hmr: Lalpa chun lunginzîngna bu le rinumna tui pe sienla cheu khawm, in inchûktirtuhai chu inbihmangin um ta naw ni hai a, in mitin in inchûk- tirtuhai chu hmu lem tâng a tih;

en: and thine ears shall hear a word behind thee, saying, This is the way, walk ye in it; when ye turn to the right hand, and when ye turn to the left.
hmr: chun, changtienga kal in chawi- in amanih, vawitienga kal in chawiin amanih, hnungtienga thu, in nain, “Hi hi lampui a nih, hitaka hin fe ro,” ti hre pei a tih.

en: And ye shall defile the overlaying of thy graven images of silver, and the plating of thy molten images of gold: thou shalt cast them away as an unclean thing; thou shalt say unto it, Get thee hence.
hmr: Chun, in tangka milim siem, tangkaruoa cheina le in rângkachak milim sung, rângkachak tuia inluon- na chu, suksieng in ta, thil pawrche angin pei tâng in tih; a kuoma chun, “Fe hmang dai rawh,” tîng in tih.

en: And he will give the rain for thy seed, wherewith thou shalt sow the ground; and bread of the increase of the ground, and it shall be fat and plenteous. In that day shall thy cattle feed in large pastures;
hmr: Chuongchun, ama chun in bu chi hnuoia in tu ding ta ding chun ruotui chu pêng a ta; hnuoia thil mâwnghai chu bu dingin pêng a tih; chu chu ṭhatak, hlâwktak nîng a ta, chu nia chun in ranhai chu ran tlatna hmun lientakahai chun tlâng an tih.

en: the oxen likewise and the young asses that till the ground shall eat savory provender, which hath been winnowed with the shovel and with the fork.
hmr: Bâwngchal le sabengtungtê hnuoi inlettuhai chun bu al, suodûr le leipupa sukfai sa, fa bawk an tih.

en: And there shall be upon every lofty mountain, and upon every high hill, brooks and streams of waters, in the day of the great slaughter, when the towers fall.
hmr: Chun, inthatna nasatak nia râl vêng inhai chu a chim ni chun, tlâng insâng tina le muol pâwng insâng tina chun vadungpuihai le vadungtê tui luonghai hung um a tih.

en: Moreover the light of the moon shall be as the light of the sun, and the light of the sun shall be sevenfold, as the light of seven days, in the day that Jehovah bindeth up the hurt of his people, and healeth the stroke of their wound.
hmr: Chu naw khawm chu, LALPA chun a mihai silna chu a tuom a, an sâtna pawphai chu a sukdam ni chun, thla var chu nisa var tlukin um tâng a ta, nisa var chu a lêt sariin, ni sari sûng var tlukin, um tâng a tih.

en: Behold, the name of Jehovah cometh from far, burning with his anger, and in thick rising smoke: his lips are full of indignation, and his tongue is as a devouring fire;
hmr: Ngai ta, LALPA hming chu, a lunginsennaa chawk hlut hlut meikhu sâmup intung lui lui lai chun, hlataka inthawkin a hung ie; a hmûr- hai chu lungninawnain a sip a, a lei chu thil kânghmang mei ang a na;

en: and his breath is as an overflowing stream, that reacheth even unto the neck, to sift the nations with the sieve of destruction: and a bridle that causeth to err shall be in the jaws of the peoples.
hmr: a thuok chu bohmangna leidâra hnam tin rel dingin, vadung rîng chen zet a kuong liem dûl dûl ang a nih; chun, mi tin baua chun ṭhuoi suoltir- na kei dingin hrui um a tih.

en: Ye shall have a song as in the night when a holy feast is kept; and gladness of heart, as when one goeth with a pipe to come unto the mountain of Jehovah, to the Rock of Israel.
hmr: Chun, zâna ruoiṭhe inthienga an ṭheh a, hla an sak angin hla sak in tih; LALPA tlânga Israelhai Lungpui kuom tlung dinga theihle le an fe laia lungril hlimna an nei angin lungril hlimna khawm nei in tih.

en: And Jehovah will cause his glorious voice to be heard, and will show the lighting down of his arm, with the indignation of his anger, and the flame of a devouring fire, with a blast, and tempest, and hailstones.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun a râwl ro- puitak chu inhriettir tâng a ta, a lunginsenna nasatak le thil kâng- hmang meichawkin, thlipui le ruopui le rielin, a kut thlâk dân chu inentir tâng a tih.

en: For through the voice of Jehovah shall the Assyrian be dismayed; with his rod will he smite him.
hmr: LALPA râwl lei chun Assuria mi, hembawka mi vaw hlaktu chu suknawiin a um ding a ni ta sih a.

en: And every stroke of the appointed staff, which Jehovah shall lay upon him, shall be with the sound of tabrets and harps; and in battles with the brandishing of his arm will he fight with them.
hmr: Ama chu hmawl ruotsaa LALPAIN a vuok po leh khuongtêhai le ṭingṭanghai leh vuong a ta; a hmawl inleta inthawnahai chun anni chu thâwng a tih.

en: For a Topheth is prepared of old; yea, for the king it is made ready; he hath made it deep and large; the pile thereof is fire and much wood; the breath of Jehovah, like a stream of brimstone, doth kindle it.
hmr: Topheth pakhat chu inhma daia lo buotsai tah a ni sih a, anih, lal ta ding chun siem zosa hieu a nih; inthûktak le lientakin a siem a, a thil sêkkhâwl chu mei le thing tamtak a nih; LALPA thuok, kât vadung luong ang chun a sukkâng dur dur a.

en: Woe to them that go down to Egypt for help, and rely on horses, and trust in chariots because they are many, and in horsemen because they are very strong, but they look not unto the Holy One of Israel, neither seek Jehovah!
hmr: Aigupta rama ṭhangpuina zawnga zu feh a, sakawrhai chunga ringna innghat a, a tam leia tawlailîrhai le an hrât êm leia sakawr chunga chuong mihai ring a, Israel- hai Mi Inthieng tieng en si loa, LALPA khawm râwn si lohai chu an chung a rik ie!

en: Yet he also is wise, and will bring evil, and will not call back his words, but will arise against the house of the evil-doers, and against the help of them that work iniquity.
hmr: Râwn naw hai sien khawm ama chu vartak i sawnnaw, thil ṭha naw hung intlungtir a ta, a thuhai chu inkîr naw ni: thil ṭha naw thawtuhai sûnghai thaw dingin tho lem a ta, thil suksuoltuhai ṭhangpuina do dingin tho bawk a tih.

en: Now the Egyptians are men, and not God; and their horses flesh, and not spirit: and when Jehovah shall stretch out his hand, both he that helpeth shall stumble, and he that is helped shall fall, and they all shall be consumed together.
hmr: Aigupta mihai chu Pathien an ni nawh a; mihriem el an na; an sakawr- hai chu thlarau an ni nawh a, tisa el an na; chuongchun, LALPAIN a kut a phar pha chun a ṭhangpuitu chu pêm thlawk thlawk a ta, a ṭhangpuina khawm chu tlûng a ta, an rêng chun bohmang vawng lem an tih.

en: For thus saith Jehovah unto me, As the lion and the young lion growling over his prey, if a multitude of shepherds be called forth against him, will not be dismayed at their voice, nor abase himself for the noise of them: so will Jehovah of hosts come down to fight upon mount Zion, and upon the hill thereof.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng ang hin ka kuomah a hril sih a, “Sakeibaknei le sakeibaknei vânglaiin a sa hau lai chun berâm vêngtu tamtak a thaw dinga ko suokin um hai sienla khawm, an râwl chu ṭi naw nih a, an risiet leiin ân tîm chuong naw ding ang hin, sipaihai LALPA chu Zion tlânga le a muol pâwnga thaw dingin a hung ṭum ding a nih.

en: As birds hovering, so will Jehovah of hosts protect Jerusalem; he will protect and deliver it, he will pass over and preserve it.
hmr: Vatehai an bu chunga an vuong an vuong ang hin sipaihai LALPA chun Jerusalem khuo chu vêng a ta; vêng a ta sansuok a tih, fe kânin humhim bawk a tih.

en: Turn ye unto him from whom ye have deeply revolted, O children of Israel.
hmr: “Aw Israel thlahai, nasataka in helsan tieng chu ngha nâwk ta ro.

en: For in that day they shall cast away every man his idols of silver, and his idols of gold, which your own hands have made unto you for a sin.
hmr: Chu nia chun mi tinin mâni tangka milimhai, mâni rângkachak milimhai, suolna dinga in kuta in siem fâwmhai chu an peihâwn ding a ni sih a.

en: And the Assyrian shall fall by the sword, not of man; and the sword, not of men, shall devour him; and he shall flee from the sword, and his young men shall become subject to taskwork.
hmr: “Chu pha chun Assuria mi chu, mihriem kâwlhnâma sukthlûk ni loin, kâwlhnâm sukthlûkin um a tih; chun, kâwlhnâm mihriemhai ta ni loin ama chu fa zo a tih; kâwlhnâma inthawk chun tlân hmang a ta, a tlangvâlhai chu sie chawitu hung ni tâng an tih.

en: And his rock shall pass away by reason of terror, and his princes shall be dismayed at the ensign, saith Jehovah, whose fire is in Zion, and his furnace in Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, a lungpui chu thil râp- thlâktak leiin bohmang a ta, a mi lienhai chu inchikna leiin lunginzîng tâng an tih,” tiin; LALPA, a mei Ziona um le, a rawtuina mei Jerusalema um chun a tih.

en: Behold, a king shall reign in righteousness, and princes shall rule in justice.
hmr: Ngai ta, lal pakhat chu feltak- in lalah ṭhung a ta, mi lienhai chun rorêlna felin ro rêl an tih.

en: And a man shall be as a hiding-place from the wind, and a covert from the tempest, as streams of water in a dry place, as the shade of a great rock in a weary land.
hmr: Mi pakhat chu thlipuia inthawka inbîkna hmun ang le, ruopuia in- thawka inbîkna ang nîng a ta, hmun ṭâwla tui luonghai ang, ram châutaka lungpui lientak hlim ang el chu.

en: And the eyes of them that see shall not be dim, and the ears of them that hear shall hearken.
hmr: Chuongchun, hmutuhai mit chu fie naw naw nih a, hretuhai na chun ngai a tih.

en: And the heart of the rash shall understand knowledge, and the tongue of the stammerers shall be ready to speak plainly.
hmr: Thaw thut hmanghai lungril chun hrietna thu chu hrefieng a ta, danginâwkhai lei chu fietakin ṭawng thei a tih.

en: The fool shall be no more called noble, nor the churl said to be bountiful.
hmr: Mi suol chu mi tiktlai ti nâwk ta naw ni hai a, mi vervêk chu mi inzaum ti nâwk ta bawk naw hi hai.

en: For the fool will speak folly, and his heart will work iniquity, to practise profaneness, and to utter error against Jehovah, to make empty the soul of the hungry, and to cause the drink of the thirsty to fail.
hmr: Pathien inza nawna thil thaw ding le, LALPA hêkna dinga thu indik naw hril dingin, phîngṭâmhai phîng sûng sukruok ding leh, dangchârhai dâwn ding sukbohmang dingin, mi suol chun suol thu a hril ding a ni sih a, a lungril chun thil suksuol bawk a tih.

en: And the instruments of the churl are evil: he deviseth wicked devices to destroy the meek with lying words, even when the needy speaketh right.
hmr: Mi vervêk thuomhnawhai chu ṭha nawtak a na; pasiehai chun thu dik an hril khawmin mi rimsihai chu khêl thua sukbohmang dingin ama chun thil suol thaw dingin a ngaituo hlak.

en: But the noble deviseth noble things; and in noble things shall he continue.
hmr: Mi tiktlai ruok chun tiktlaina thil tieng chu a ngaituo hlak a; chuong- chun, tiktlaina tieng thilahai chun um zing a tih.

en: Rise up, ye women that are at ease, and hear my voice; ye careless daughters, give ear unto my speech.
hmr: Nuhmei um mei meihai, tho unla, ka râwl hi ngai ta u; naunu ngaisamhai, ka thu hrila hin na sit ro.

en: For days beyond a year shall ye be troubled, ye careless women; for the vintage shall fail, the ingathering shall not come.
hmr: Nuhmei ngaisamhai, kum khat le ni ieng amani zât chena chun lunginzîng tâng in tih; grêp lo ding hlak a um âwm si nawh a, grêp lo khâwm dinga chun iengkhawm a hung pieng âwm si nawh a.

en: Tremble, ye women that are at ease; be troubled, ye careless ones; strip you, and make you bare, and gird sackcloth upon your loins.
hmr: Nuhmei um mei meihai, inthin ro; mi ngaisamhai, lunginzîngtakin um ro, inhlîp unla, saruokin insiem unla, in kâwngahai chun saiip puon bi ro.

en: They shall smite upon the breasts for the pleasant fields, for the fruitful vine.
hmr: Lo ditumhai lei le grêphrui ra nuom mi lei chun in âwm inchum inchum ro.

en: Upon the land of my people shall come up thorns and briers; yea, upon all the houses of joy in the joyous city.
hmr: Ka mihai rama hin hlohling- neihai le buorhai chu tlâng a tih; anih, khawpui hlimumtaka hlimna in po pohai chunga chun,

en: For the palace shall be forsaken; the populous city shall be deserted; the hill and the watch-tower shall be for dens for ever, a joy of wild asses, a pasture of flocks;
hmr: lal in chu mâksanin a um ding a ni sih a; mi tamna khawpui chu suok- sanin a um ding a na; a muol pâwng le a râlvêng bûkhai chu kumkhaw pûk dâm, ram sabengtung lâwmna dâm, ranruol tlatna hmunhai hung nîng a tih;

en: until the Spirit be poured upon us from on high, and the wilderness become a fruitful field, and the fruitful field be esteemed as a forest.
hmr: Chung tienga thlarau chu ei chunga bura a um a, thlalêr chu hnuoi ṭhatak hmuna ân chang a, hnuoi ṭhatak hmun chu rampuia ngaia a um hmakhat chun.

en: Then justice shall dwell in the wilderness; and righteousness shall abide in the fruitful field.
hmr: Chupha chun rorêl felna chu thlalêra chun chêng a ta, felna chu hnuoi ṭhatakna hmuna chun um a tih.

en: And the work of righteousness shall be peace; and the effect of righteousness, quietness and confidence for ever.
hmr: Chun, felna sinthaw chu inrem- na nîng a ta, felna thil suok chu kumkhuoa muongtaka umna le ring tlata umna nîng a tih.

en: And my people shall abide in a peaceable habitation, and in safe dwellings, and in quiet resting-places.
hmr: Chuongchun, ka mihai chu râl- muonga umnaahai le in dettakhaia le châwlna hmun muongumtakhaia chun um tâng an tih.

en: But it shall hail in the downfall of the forest; and the city shall be utterly laid low.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, rampui chu sukthlu dingin riel tla dur dur a ta; khawpui chu suktlâwm dêrin um a tih.

en: Blessed are ye that sow beside all waters, that send forth the feet of the ox and the ass.
hmr: Tui luongna po po panga chi the hlaktuhai le, bâwngchal le sabeng- tung inthla hlakhai, in hamṭha ie.

en: Woe to thee that destroyest, and thou wast not destroyed; and dealest treacherously, and they dealt not treacherously with thee! When thou hast ceased to destroy, thou shalt be destroyed; and when thou hast made an end of dealing treacherously, they shall deal treacherously with thee.
hmr: Nang rawk tuok ngai si loa, rawktu, vervêktaka thaw tuok ngai si loa, vervêktaka thawtu, i chung a rik ie! Mi rawk i bân phaleh, rawk la tuok vêng i ta; vervêktaka i thaw zo phaleh i chungah vervêk- takin thâwng an tih.

en: O Jehovah, be gracious unto us; we have waited for thee: be thou our arm every morning, our salvation also in the time of trouble.
hmr: Aw LALPA, mi lunginsiet la; kan nghâk zing che hi: tûk tin kan bân hung ni la, lunginzîng huna chun a mi sandamtu hung ni bawk rawh.

en: At the noise of the tumult the peoples are fled; at the lifting up of thyself the nations are scattered.
hmr: Sa mur mur ria chun mi tin chu an tlân hmang tah a; nang i hung tho meu chun hnam tin chu sukdarin an um tah.

en: And your spoil shall be gathered as the caterpillar gathereth: as locusts leap shall men leap upon it.
hmr: In sum râllâka lâk ding chu thilhringin thil an thak khâwm sup sup ang hin thak khâwmin um a ta; khâuṭhikṭhihai an inchâwm sup sup ang hin annirawi chu sum chunga chun inchâwm sup sup an tih.

en: Jehovah is exalted; for he dwelleth on high: he hath filled Zion with justice and righteousness.
hmr: LALPA chu chawisângin a um tah; chungtienga khin a um sih a; ama chun Zion chu rorêl felna le felnain a suksip tah.

en: And there shall be stability in thy times, abundance of salvation, wisdom, and knowledge: the fear of Jehovah is thy treasure.
hmr: I dam sûng chun um nghetna um a ta, sandamna dâm, varna dâm, hrietna dâm um ṭeu a tih; LALPA ṭîna chu a ro a nih.

en: Behold, their valiant ones cry without; the ambassadors of peace weep bitterly.
hmr: Ngai ta, an pasalṭhahai chu tuol- tieng an khêk a, inremna palaihai chu an ṭap an ṭap a.

en: The highways lie waste, the wayfaring man ceaseth: the enemy hath broken the covenant, he hath despised the cities, he regardeth not man.
hmr: Lamlienhai chu a ṭhing ṭhiep ṭhuop a, mi inzin inlawn chu an um ta nawh a, ama chun thuthlunghai chu a bawsiet a, khuohai chu a hmusit a, mihriem a ngaisak ta nawh.

en: The land mourneth and languisheth; Lebanon is confounded and withereth away; Sharon is like a desert; and Bashan and Carmel shake off their leaves.
hmr: Ram chu a ṭapin a châu a; Leba- non chu ân zakin a vuoi a, Saron chu thlalêr ang a ni tah; Basan le Karmel chun an hnahai an thin thlâk a.

en: Now will I arise, saith Jehovah; now will I lift up myself; now will I be exalted.
