en: But Ahaz said, I will not ask, neither will I tempt Jehovah.
hmr: Ahaz ruok chun, “Hni naw ning ah, LALPA khawm infie bawk naw ning ah,” a ta.

en: And he said, Hear ye now, O house of David: Is it a small thing for you to weary men, that ye will weary my God also?
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “Aw David sûnghai, tuhin lo ngai ta u, mihriem suksâwl hi thil chiretekah in ruot a ni maw? Ka Pathien chen khawm suk- sâwl in nuom rawp hi.

en: Therefore the Lord himself will give you a sign: behold, a virgin shall conceive, and bear a son, and shall call his name Immanuel.
hmr: Chuleiin, LALPA ngei chun inchikna pêng a ti cheu a, ngai ta u, nunghâk inthieng pakhat inrai a ta, naupasal nei a ta, a hmingah Im- manuel sak a tih.

en: Butter and honey shall he eat, when he knoweth to refuse the evil, and choose the good.
hmr: Ama chun thil ṭha naw tieng dit naw dân a hriet a, thil ṭha tieng dit nachâng a hriet pha chun nênetui kîng le khuoizu fa hlak a tih.

en: For before the child shall know to refuse the evil, and choose the good, the land whose two kings thou abhorrest shall be forsaken.
hmr: Naupang chu thil ṭha naw tieng dit naw nachâng le thil ṭha tieng dit nachâng a hriet hma khawmin lal pahni i theidahai ram chu rausanin um a tih.

en: Jehovah will bring upon thee, and upon thy people, and upon thy father’s house, days that have not come, from the day that Ephraim departed from Judah—even the king of Assyria.
hmr: Ephraim chun Juda a ṭhe nia inthawka la tlung ngailo nihai chu LALPA chun i chunga le, i khuoletui- hai chunga le, i pa sûnghai chunga chun intlungtir a tih; Assuria lal ngei chu,” a ta.

en: And it shall come to pass in that day, that Jehovah will hiss for the fly that is in the uttermost part of the rivers of Egypt, and for the bee that is in the land of Assyria.
hmr: Chu nia chun LALPA chu Aigupta vadung tâwp rêta tho um le, Assuria rama khuoi um chu ko dingin faifûk a tih.

en: And they shall come, and shall rest all of them in the desolate valleys, and in the clefts of the rocks, and upon all thorn-hedges, and upon all pastures.
hmr: Chuongchun, hung an ta, an rêngin vadung ruom se rek rukahai, lungpui pûka dâm, hlohlingnei po poa dâm, ran tlatna hmun po poahai fûng an tih.

en: In that day will the Lord shave with a razor that is hired in the parts beyond the River, even with the king of Assyria, the head and the hair of the feet; and it shall also consume the beard.
hmr: Chu nia chun LALPAIN rêpvâw haw, Vadungpui khêl rama, Assuria lal um chu hmangin, lu le ke hmul chu mêt fai a ta, khâk hmul khawm mêt fai vawng a tih.

en: And it shall come to pass in that day, that a man shall keep alive a young cow, and two sheep;
hmr: Chuongchun, chu nia chun mi pakhatin bâwngla pakhat le berâm pahni chau vâi a tih;

en: and it shall come to pass, that because of the abundance of milk which they shall give he shall eat butter: for butter and honey shall every one eat that is left in the midst of the land.
hmr: nisienlakhawm, nênetui tam- tak an la pêk ding a ni leiin nênetui kîng fa hlak a tih; ram sûnga la umhai po chun nênetui kîng le khuoizu an la fâk seng ding a ni sih a.

en: And it shall come to pass in that day, that every place, where there were a thousand vines at a thousand silverlings, shall be for briers and thorns.
hmr: Chun, chu nia chun hmun tin, grêp hrui sâng, tangka sâng man umna taphawt chu, buor le hlohling- nei hmun el hung ni tâng a tih.

en: With arrows and with bow shall one come thither, because all the land shall be briers and thorns.
hmr: Ram po po chu buor le hlohling- nei hmun ruok a hung ni tâk leiin chutaka chun thal le thalngul chawi- in fêng an tih.

en: And all the hills that were digged with the mattock, thou shalt not come thither for fear of briers and thorns; but it shall be for the sending forth of oxen, and for the treading of sheep.
hmr: Chun, tlâng bâwngtuthlawa cho ta po poa chun, buor le hlohlingnei ṭi leiin hung naw ti nih a, bâwngchalhai intlâttirna le berâm ichîl el ding ni ta lem a tih.

en: And Jehovah said unto me, Take thee a great tablet, and write upon it with the pen of a man, For Maher-shalal-hash-baz;
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun ka kuomah, “Lekha ziekna phêk lientak la la, mihriem kawlawmin a chungah, ‘Mahersalal-has-baz ta ding,’ tiin ziek rawh;

en: and I will take unto me faithful witnesses to record, Uriah the priest, and Zechariah the son of Jeberechiah.
hmr: chuongchun, hretu ringum, thiempu Uria le Jeberekia naupa Zekaria chu hrietpuitu dingin siem ka tih,” a ta.

en: And I went unto the prophetess; and she conceived, and bare a son. Then said Jehovah unto me, Call his name Maher-shalal-hash-baz.
hmr: Chun, zâwlneinu kuoma chun ka feh a, chuongchun, ama chun nau a vawn a, naupasal a nei tah a. Chuongchun, LALPAIN ka kuomah, “A hmingah Maher-salal-has-baz sak rawh.

en: For before the child shall have knowledge to cry, My father, and, My mother, the riches of Damascus and the spoil of Samaria shall be carried away before the king of Assyria.
hmr: Naupang chun, ‘Nu, Pa,’ ti na- châng a hriet hma khawmin Damas- ka hausaknahai le Samaria inthawka râllâk sumhai chu Assuria lal hmaah an fe hmangpui ding a ni sih a,” a ta.

en: And Jehovah spake unto me yet again, saying,
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun ka kuomah a hril nâwk a,

en: Forasmuch as this people have refused the waters of Shiloah that go softly, and rejoice in Rezin and Remaliah’s son;
hmr: “Hieng chihai hin Siloa tui damtêa luong dêl dêlhai chu an dit naw lei le, Rezin le Remalia naupa chunga an lâwm leiin,

en: now therefore, behold, the Lord bringeth up upon them the waters of the River, strong and many, even the king of Assyria and all his glory: and it shall come up over all its channels, and go over all its banks;
hmr: ngai ta, LALPA chun Vadungpui tui, hrâttakhai le tamtakhai, (Assu- ria lal le a ropuina po po chu) an chungah inluongtir a tih; chuong- chun, a kuong po po chu hung liem dûl dûlin, a pang po poa chun hung liem dûl dûl a tih;

en: and it shall sweep onward into Judah; it shall overflow and pass through; it shall reach even to the neck; and the stretching out of its wings shall fill the breadth of thy land, O Immanuel.
hmr: chun, Juda ram chenin chîm tlum dum dum a ta, a liemin luong tlang dum dum a ta, rîng khawm chîm phâk hiel a tih; chun, a thla zar chun, Aw Immanuel, i ram khang tieng po po hi aw vawng a tih.

en: Make an uproar, O ye peoples, and be broken in pieces; and give ear, all ye of far countries: gird yourselves, and be broken in pieces; gird yourselves, and be broken in pieces.
hmr: “Chi tinhai, buoi nuoi nuoi ta unla, kawinawiin in um ding a nih; ram hlataka mi po pohai, na sit unla, inrâlthuom ro; kawinâwiin in um ding a nih; inrâlthuom ro, kawi- nâwiin in um ding a nih.

en: Take counsel together, and it shall be brought to nought; speak the word, and it shall not stand: for God is with us.
hmr: Inrâwn khâwm ro, iengkhawm ni hliek naw ni; thu hril ro, puitling chuong bawk naw nih; Pathien ei kuomah a um sih a,” tiin.

en: For Jehovah spake thus to me with a strong hand, and instructed me not to walk in the way of this people, saying,
hmr: LALPA chun kut hrâttakin hieng ang hin ka kuomah a hril a, hi chihai lampuia hin ka fe ve nawna dingin a mi thunun a ni hi:

en: Say ye not, A conspiracy, concerning all whereof this people shall say, A conspiracy; neither fear ye their fear, nor be in dread thereof.
hmr: “Hi chihai hin, ‘Phier an nei,’ an ti nazawng chu, ‘Phier an nei,’ ti ve naw ro; an ṭi khawm chu ṭi ve loin, ṭi ve naw ro.

en: Jehovah of hosts, him shall ye sanctify; and let him be your fear, and let him be your dread.
hmr: Sipaihai Lalpa, ama ngei chu in sukthieng ding a nih, ama chu in iṭi chu ni sienla, ama chu in iṭi chu ni raw se.

en: And he shall be for a sanctuary; but for a stone of stumbling and for a rock of offence to both the houses of Israel, for a gin and for a snare to the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, ama chu hmun inthieng nîng a ta. Israel sûng hnihai ta ding ruok chun tlûkna lung le dangna lungpui ni lem a tih. Jerusalema umhai ta ding chun châng le bil ni bawk a tih.

en: And many shall stumble thereon, and fall, and be broken, and be snared, and be taken.
hmr: Chuongchun, mi tamtakin chu chu insuiin tlûng an ta, suknâwiin um an ta, âwk an ta, manin um an tih,” tiin.

en: Bind thou up the testimony, seal the law among my disciples.
hmr: Inhriettirna thu ziel hi khuop la, dân thu hi ka inchûktirhai lai namin inchik rawh.

en: And I will wait for Jehovah, that hideth his face from the house of Jacob, and I will look for him.
hmr: Kei chun Jakob sûnghai laia a hmai thuptu LALPA chu nghâk ka ta, ama chu thlîr zing ka tih.

en: Behold, I and the children whom Jehovah hath given me are for signs and for wonders in Israel from Jehovah of hosts, who dwelleth in mount Zion.
hmr: Ngai ta, kei le LALPA mi pêk naupanghai hi, Israelhai lai hin sipaihai LALPA Zion tlânga um kuoma inthawka inchikna ding le thilmakhai ding dâm kan nih.

en: And when they shall say unto you, Seek unto them that have familiar spirits and unto the wizards, that chirp and that mutter: should not a people seek unto their God? on behalf of the living should they seek unto the dead?
hmr: Chun, miin, “Khawhri aisân- thiem zâwl le, dawithiem thûm bul bul le chier hmur hmurhai chu râwn ro,” an ti pha cheu chun hieng ang hin dawn ro; “Mihaiin an Pathien chu an râwn ding a ni lem naw am a nih? Mi hring ta ding chun mithi an râwn ding am a nih?

en: To the law and to the testimony! if they speak not according to this word, surely there is no morning for them.
hmr: Dân thu le Inhriettirna Thu chu râwn lem ding a nih,” tiin. Chuong ang thu ang peia an hril naw chun an ta dingin khuo hrim hrim var dêr naw nih.

en: And they shall pass through it, sore distressed and hungry; and it shall come to pass that, when they shall be hungry, they shall fret themselves, and curse by their king and by their God, and turn their faces upward:
hmr: Lunginzîngtak le phîngṭâm pumin ram chu fang an ta, an phîng a ṭâm pha chun an lung chu sen êm êm a ta, an lal le an Pathien chu ṭawngsie inphur bawr bawr an ta, vân tieng dâk rak rak an tih;

en: and they shall look unto the earth, and, behold, distress and darkness, the gloom of anguish; and into thick darkness they shall be driven away.
hmr: chun, hnuoi tieng nghâng an ta, ngai ta, lunginzîngna le inthimna, thlaphâng ngûina chu nîng a tih; chuongchun, inthim sâmupa hnawt hmangin um an tih.

en: But there shall be no gloom to her that was in anguish. In the former time he brought into contempt the land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali; but in the latter time hath he made it glorious, by the way of the sea, beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the nations.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, lunginzînga um- nu ta ding chun nguina hrim hrim um ta naw nih a. Tienlai chun Zebulun ram le Naphtali ram chu hmusitumin ân umtir a; nisienla- khawm, hun nuhnunga chun ro- puitakin ân umtir tah a, dîl pang- ah, Jordan râlah, hnam tin Galili chu.

en: The people that walked in darkness have seen a great light: they that dwelt in the land of the shadow of death, upon them hath the light shined.
hmr: Mi inthim hnuoia fehai chun var nasatak an hmu tah a; thina hlim rama umhai chunga ngei chun var a hung var tah a.

en: Thou hast multiplied the nation, thou hast increased their joy: they joy before thee according to the joy in harvest, as men rejoice when they divide the spoil.
hmr: Hnam chu i suktam tah a, an hlimna khawm i sukpung tah a; bu sîk laia hlim angin i hmaah an hlim tah a, miin râllâk sum an sema an hlim ang elin.

en: For the yoke of his burden, and the staff of his shoulder, the rod of his oppressor, thou hast broken as in the day of Midian.
hmr: A rikphurna rîngkawl le a lieng- koa zâwnfung, a nêksâwrtu hem- bâwk chu, Midianhai hne ni ang khan i suktliekpêk ta sih a.

en: For all the armor of the armed man in the tumult, and the garments rolled in blood, shall be for burning, for fuel of fire.
hmr: Sa mur mura mi râlthuoma ân thuomna po po le, silfên thisen le inchiepawl niei nuoi po po chu, rawa meia ti ding el chau a ni sih a.

en: For unto us a child is born, unto us a son is given; and the government shall be upon his shoulder: and his name shall be called Wonderful, Counsellor, Mighty God, Everlasting Father, Prince of Peace.
hmr: Ei ta dingin naupang a hung pieng a, naupa pêkin ei um tah a; rorêlna chu a liengkoah chuong a ta, a hminga chun Maka, Remruottu, Pathien Hrât, Chatuon Pa, Remna Lal an ti ding a ni sih a.

en: Of the increase of his government and of peace there shall be no end, upon the throne of David, and upon his kingdom, to establish it, and to uphold it with justice and with righteousness from henceforth even for ever. The zeal of Jehovah of hosts will perform this.
hmr: David lalṭhungpha chunga le a ram chungah a rorêlna pungzie le inremnain tâwpintai nei naw nih, sukdet ding le tuta inthawka chatuon chen khawma rorêlna le felnaa tung- ding dingin. Sipaihai LALPA ṭha- hnemngaina chun chuong chu thâwng a tih.

en: The Lord sent a word into Jacob, and it hath lighted upon Israel.
hmr: Lalpa chun Jakobhai rama chun thu a thawn a, Israelhai chungah a tla tah a.

en: And all the people shall know, even Ephraim and the inhabitant of Samaria, that say in pride and in stoutness of heart,
hmr: Chuongchun, mi po po, Ephraim- hai le Samaria um, chapotak le lungrila uongtaka,

en: The bricks are fallen, but we will build with hewn stone; the sycomores are cut down, but we will put cedars in their place.
hmr: “Ṭêkleihai chu chim sienla khawm, lungthîr sutin rem el ei tih; theichang thinghai chu sât bawngin um sienla khawm, sidar thinghaiin thleng el ei tih,” tituhai chun la hrieng an tih.

en: Therefore Jehovah will set up on high against him the adversaries of Rezin, and will stir up his enemies,
hmr: Chuleiin, LALPA chun Rezin dotuhai chu ama do dingin chawisâng a ta, a hmêlmahai chu chawktho a tih.

en: the Syrians before, and the Philistines behind; and they shall devour Israel with open mouth. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
hmr: Saktieng Suria mihai, thlang- tieng Philistin mihai chun bau kain Israelhai chu fa zo an tih. Chuong ang lâwma a thaw khawm chun a lunginsen chu a la bo chuong si nawh a; a kut chu a lân let ta rawp a.

en: Yet the people have not turned unto him that smote them, neither have they sought Jehovah of hosts.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, mihai chun anni vawtu tieng chu an ngha chuong si nawh a, sipaihai LALPA chu an zawng chuong bawk nawh.

en: Therefore Jehovah will cut off from Israel head and tail, palm-branch and rush, in one day.
hmr: Chuleiin, LALPA chun Israel- haia inthawk chun a lu le a mei, intûm kau le thielkuong ni khat thilah sawk tâwl a tih.

en: The elder and the honorable man, he is the head; and the prophet that teacheth lies, he is the tail.
hmr: Upa le mi inzaumhai chu a lu chu an na, khêl inchûktir hlak zâwl- neihai chu a mei chu an nih.

en: For they that lead this people cause them to err; and they that are led of them are destroyed.
hmr: Hieng mihai ṭhuoituhai hin an ṭhuoi suol hlak a nih, an iṭhuoihai chu sukbohmangin an um hlak a nih.

en: Therefore the Lord will not rejoice over their young men, neither will he have compassion on their fatherless and widows; for every one is profane and an evil-doer, and every mouth speaketh folly. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
hmr: Chuleiin, LALPA chu an tlang- vâlhai chungah lâwm naw nih a, an naufahrahai le hmeithaihai chu lunginsiet bawk naw nih; an rêngin Pathien inzâ naw mi le thil ṭha naw thawtu an ni vawng a, bau po po chun thu teplo a hril seng sih a. Chuong ang lâwma a thaw khawm chun a lunginsen chu a la bo chuong si nawh a, a kut chu a lân let ta rawp a.

en: For wickedness burneth as the fire; it devoureth the briers and thorns; yea, it kindleth in the thickets of the forest, and they roll upward in a column of smoke.
hmr: Rîtlona chu mei angin a chawk dur dur hlak sih a, buor le hlohling- neihai chu a kâng hmang hlak; anih, ramhnuoi thing bitna hmunahai chun a kâng dur dur a, a khu ân tung ngut ngut hlak.

en: Through the wrath of Jehovah of hosts is the land burnt up; and the people are as the fuel of fire: no man spareth his brother.
hmr: Sipaihai LALPA lunginsenna leiin ram chu a kâng siet a, mihai khawm chu meia ti ding thing ang an na; tukhawma mâni unau ngei khawm an hla nawh.

en: And one shall snatch on the right hand, and be hungry; and he shall eat on the left hand, and they shall not be satisfied: they shall eat every man the flesh of his own arm:
hmr: Chuongchun, miin an chang- tienga mi inchûng an ta, nisienla- khawm, an phîng la ṭâm ta rawp a ta, an vawitienga mi fâng an ta, nisien- lakhawm, tlai chuong naw ni hai, mi tinin mâni bân taksa fa seng an tih.

en: Manasseh, Ephraim; and Ephraim, Manasseh; and they together shall be against Judah. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
hmr: Manassehaiin Ephraimhai fâng an ta, Ephraimhaiin Manassehai fâng an tih; chun, an pahni chun Judahai do hmunkhat an tih. Chuong ang lâwma a thaw khawm chun a lunginsen chu a bo si nawh a, a kut chu a lân let ta rawp a.
